Description:
Powerful & Dangerous Goblin Technology!

This instance is prettymuch a testbed for whatever wacky code is running on the main branch of GoToSocial at any given time, though it's deployed from other branches as well sometimes.

It's also used as a more or less single-user instance by @tobi although there are some other folks with accounts on here too.

This instance runs on a 1-cpu, 1024mb vps from Greenhost.

This is because:

  1. It's cheap(ish).
  2. Greenhost is alright.
  3. Running on a low-spec machine is a good way to make sure that GoToSocial performance is OK.

The blocklist is over 1,000 domains. Don't be a dick head or you get yote.

The "fediverse" is a shibboleth and free and open federation is nonsense. This instance has a massive blocklist because I can't be arsed changing everyone's diapers all the time. There is no appeals process.
Short:
Powerful & Dangerous Goblin Technology!

This instance runs on a 1-cpu, 1024mb vps from Greenhost.

The blocklist is over 1,000 domains. Don't be a dick head or you get yote.

Description:
Подробности регистрации по ссылке
Соцсеть «Союза Советских Писателей» предназначена для взаимопомощи и развития советской культуры писателями, публицистами и журналистами.
Союз соответствует ценностям советского образа жизни и будущего.

Запрещена, пропаганда и реклама деструктивных идеологий.
Запрещена, любая порнография, навязчивая реклама от корпораций, сетевых маркетологов.
Запрещены, антисоветские фильмы, мультфильмы, игры, анекдоты.
Запрещены, шовинистические измышления, расовая теория, сегрегация на вакцинированных и не вакцинированных.
Запрещены нарушения УК.
Эти нарушения могут подвергаться жалобам и банам от пользователей.

У каждого пользователя будет свой микроблог с публикациями до 500 знаков в каждой публикации.
Вы сможете импортировать видео, фото, подкасты, из своих прежних ресурсов.
В публикациях есть функция глобальных опросов.
Личные сообщения отправляются через @ и никнейм адресат.
Лайки звёздочки повышают рейтинг микроблогов.
Функции репостов и экспорта публикаций присутствуют у каждого микроблога.

 

 • Политика конфиденциальности

Данная соцсеть не использует алгоритмы таргетированной рекламы и слежки за пользователями в онлайн времени.

Ваши личные данные не передаются в рекламные сети и компетентные базы.

Разговоры о проблеме вакцинации и теории конспирологов не ограничиваются и не удаляются.

Свобода слова и совести защищена в контексте развития советской литературы.
Short: Вход в "Союз Писателей", со стороны узла "КУБ-2091", смарт-государства КУБ (КУБ-тв). Через влияние письменным словом на культуру, изменим общество к лучшему. Инженеры человеческих душ - объединяйтесь!
This is a private server and you probably shouldn‘t be here.

Description:
Vítejte na Mastodon serveru kompost.cz, provozovaném Františkem Fukou.

Registrace jsou omezené a pouze na pozvánky. Pokud se chcete stát uživatelem tohoto serveru a pokud souhlasíte s jeho podmínkami užívání, kontaktujte Františka Fuku. Pokud nemáte žádný kontakt na Františka Fuku, je vysoce pravděpodobné, že se nemůžete stát uživatelem tohoto serveru. Ale ani v takovém případě vám nic nebrání založit si účet na libovolném jiném Mastodon serveru, nebo si zprovoznit vlastní server, a pak se propojit s uživateli kompost.cz, komunikovat s nimi a sledovat jejich aktivitu.

Pokud chcete pouze sledovat aktivitu někoho na tomto serveru (například Františka Fuky), žádnou registraci k tomu nepotřebujete, stačí se pouze řídit návodem zde.

P.S: Původní spolutvůrci původního Kompostu mi laskavě přenechali tuto slavnou doménu, ale se současným obsahem nemají nic společného.

P.P.S: Za provozování kompost.cz, který má necelých 10 aktivních uživatelů, platím cca. 11 dolarů měsíčně. Nezruinuje mě to, ale pokud mi chcete finančně vypomoci, můžete to nejjednoduššeji udělat zde.
Short: Kompost.cz je fediverse server Františka Fuky.

Description:
einbeck.social

... ist eine Mastodon-Instanz für Einbeck und den Raum Südniedersachsen und ist Teil des Fediverse.

Mastodon ist am ehesten mit Twitter vergleichbar, allerdings dezentral. Jeder kann sich einen eigenen Server aufsetzen und an dem Netzwerk teilnehmen. Nachrichten (Toots) werden automatisch zwischen sich folgenden Accounts und dessen Servern ausgetauscht.

Mastodon ist Privatsphäre freundlich und datensparsam. Mastodon ist frei von Analyse-Algorithmen. Somit ist Mastodon in der Praxis frei von kommerzieller Ausbeutung, frei von Werbung und frei von Abspeichern und Auswertung unserer Interessen und Vorlieben. Das ist der Mehrwert von Mastodon und dem Fediverse – ungestörter und freier Austausch in den „sozialen Medien“.

Impressum

Diese Mastodon Instanz wird vom nerdbridge e.V. Einbeck betrieben.

Siehe für weitere Details unser Website Impressum
Short: Mastodon Instanz für Einbeck, einer Stadt in Südniedersachsen. Betrieben vom nerdbridge e.V. Einbeck

Description:
We have few rules but they do count nonetheless:

  1. No hate speech. You will be banned.
  2. No illegal activities.
  3. No pornography. Of any kind.
  4. Cute photos with kittens or puppys always welcome.

Please read our complete list of rules to get the idea.

Be kind, understanding and open to each other.

If you come from The Blue Bird site (aka 'Shitter') and want Mastodon to be equally messed up, please find another instance to join. If you, however, accept that Mastodon is different, friendlier and more personal than 'Shitter', feel free to register here.

Thanks,

The management
Short: Swedish instance running on a Linux server somewhere in Finland.

Description:
- Welcome to loci.onl -

This is a small mastodon instance with the goal of helping people get into using the Fediverse and give a gentle introduction by providing an place populated with people they know directly, or at one step remove - friends and friends-of-friends. The idea behind this was to make an instance linked to the sort of geeky and/or roleplayer community of Hanging Town and its surrounding area, but also open to people connected to that wide social environment by various means. It's expected some people will use this place and then migrate away to other parts of the Fediverse once they've explored a little.

The goal is curate a good friendly atmosphere of people who are reasonably geographically local (sort of like the old days of regional BBS), but with some a bit further away, and to ask the question "If you could run your own social network what would that look like?"

This is not a public instance, if you want an account feel free to apply for one and let the admin know who you are.

Oh and please set a profile picture, even if its not of you but of something totally random, default profile pics just piss your humble admin off.

This experiment has been running since late 2018 - and people still like that it exists and its not too much bother so its carrying on. If it ever needs to shut down people will get several months notice and help from the admin to migrate to other instances and archive their posts and things.

There's also an XMPP server available (super duper no guarantees on that uptime) and if you want similar social federated services please talk to the admin.

- Code of Conduct -

We are broadly following the code of conduct from the flagship instance, roughly reworded for application here - honestly I'm not really expecting this to come up much.

Specific instance rules are below.

Broadly moderation of other instances follows the no nazis at the bar policy, if another instance has problem users but insists they're not being a problem on that instance when its obvious they're posting shit elsewhere - then that instance has failed the test and will get silenced or suspended.

With Regards Content Warnings:

  • Please CW your posts for politics, bigotry, common stressors, or just because you want to use them like a subject line.
  • If you don't wish to have to click to expand them you can use: Preferences -> "Always expand posts marked with content warnings". But please still CW your posts for others.
  • Sometimes various people will not CW their posts when talking about their own experiences good or bad, please be understanding that their instances CW policy is not ours to police so don't bug them about it.
  • If you see content you feel should have a CW but doesn't then there are a lot of ways to deal with this.
    • If its a one off you can scroll past and assume they're having a bad day or just being open about their experience or sharing something they feel is very important.
    • If it happens more frequently you can filter your feed in a lot of ways yourself - blocking keywords (either for a time or permanently), muting users (either for a time or permanently), unfollowing users, blocking users or even whole instances (who you see boosted by others), and applying filters that hide posts behind a CW/filter automatically.
    • All of this can be done yourself but if a whole instance is routinely showing poor behaviour talk to the admin about defederating from the whole thing.

- Terms Of Use / Privacy Policy -

Server resources (like the Earths resources) are not infinite. Admin time, patience, and knowledge are also not infinite. However both these things are there to be used - just try not to exhaust them.

See the terms of use/privacy policy for details on data handling, resource usage policy, and general situations in which the admin may wind up peering at your data or asking and helping you to migrate to another instance, as well as legally where this server exists and which governments may fuck with us.

This instance blocks a number of shitty instances, if you view this page while logged in you'll see a list

- Research / Data-Mining Policy -

Researchers who wish to study instance or our members by collecting data using the API, web scraping, or through any other means must get an "opt-in" consent from each individual person (this does not apply to people receiving surveys because they follow your account).

Data-Miners or anyone else bulk searching/recording contents from the Fediverse are prohibited from automatically gathering data from this instance to provide search or anything else which could be monetised or create an attack or discovery vector (this does not apply to statistics collection hubs or directories that individual people add themselves to).


- Additional -

More about The Fediverse

  • Want tips for getting the most out of the Fediverse? Follow @feditips
  • Fedi.tips also has An Unofficial Guide to Mastodon and the Fediverse for non-technical people
  • Mastodon for Creators by @AimeeMaroux of Erotic Mythology fame - gives advice on how to find people and engage them.
  • Notes from a Mastodon migration by @kissane - gives a 2023 view of the hows and whys to migrate between instances.
  • A futuristic Mastodon introduction for 2021 (text) Elilla's slightly tongue in cheek Fediverse overview
  • Mastodon for Twitter users in 5 minutes (text) from Elilla attempting to explain the cultural and technological differences between the Fediverse and Twitter.
  • "A Brief Mastodon Guide for Social Media Worriers" (text) by Per Axbom (@axbom@social.xbm.se)
  • What is the Fediverse? (video) published by Framasoft
  • Mastodon: What you need to know for your security and privacy from Graham Cluley including advice on verifying users
  • "Getting started with Mastodon" (text, a little out of date now) and also "How Does Mastodon Work?" (text) by Kev Quirk
  • "What is Mastodon" (video) from the Mastodon project
  • "Intro to Mastodon 101" (video) by Haphazard Audiophilia
  • Distributed social media - Mastodon & Fediverse Explained (video)
  • "An Increasingly Less-Brief Guide to Mastodon" (text) by Ellie
  • Official Mastodon Project Documentation (text) including a complete user guide (text)
  • Run Your Own Social (text) - A site about running your own social network for friends
  • Grow Your Own Services (text) - A site of advice about running small social networks, online clouds, blogs, etc.
  • The Federation - A statistics hub
  • Fediverse.party - Links to distributed/federated social systems
  • Fediverse.space - Maps connections between instances
  • Switching.software - Advice on decentralised software you can switch too from centrally controlled versions


Finding people, stuff, and places:

  • Main page, left hand column has a user/hashtag search box
  • Mastodon Trunk - helps you follow a bunch of people who are interested in various topics to get started finding people, also has some organisations. They have a few hundred lists, but examples that may be specifically interesting for us are: RPGs, Academia, Board Games, Gardening, UK Politics, Philosophy, Photography, and Writing. Seriously go take a look.
  • fediverse.info Searchable Directory - a searchable directory of users you can add yourself too
  • Guppe Groups - public discussion "groups" where you can address a post @ a group and everyone following that group will see it so its easier to find and talk to people by interest.
  • Follow @FediFollows for recommendations
  • Check the FediDirectory which is run by FediFollows
  • Finding People to Follow on Mastodon from Masto.host
  • Fedifinder - helps find people you followed on twitter on the fedi
  • bird.makeup allows you to follow twitter users from the fediverse so you can keep track of people over there (as a warning boosting posts from twitter users may make some people grumpy)
  • Search for users -
    • Check the local timeline for locally active users
    • Check Explore Mastodon for this instances well followed users and common hashtags, also available on every other up to date instance, e.g. mastodon.social/explore
  • Search for content -
    • Click on hashtags to show posts this instance has seen - the fediverse tends to search around hashtags not text
    • Open hashtag link in new tab for posts remote servers has seen
    • View Federated Timeline for every toot this server has seen
    • View public toots from many instances by checking their /public URL, for example mastodon.social/public
    • Sepia Search - For Searching Peertube from Framasoft.
    • How to follow topics on Mastodon (video) short guide to user interface to follow a topic/hashtag
  • Search for other instances -
    • joinmastodon.org - Has instances by region and topic
    • instances.social - Has a wizard to help you choose an instance based on size, content policy, etc.
    • fediverse.observer - Finds instances, can search for them geographically close
    • Fedi.Garden is a small human-curated list of nice, well run servers on Mastodon and the wider Fediverse

  • Masto.host offers fully managed mastodon instances if you want to run your own, or I can give you a hand with sysadmin advice if you want to self host.
  • Spacebear Federation offers managed Mastodon, Pixelfed, Peertube, Hometown, or Pleroma instances
  • Other cool instances that may interest people include: tabletop.social (tabletop, roleplaying, LARPers, etc), dice.camp (RPG people of all kinds), Elekk (an instance for gamers of all kinds, except shitty ones), wandering.shop (scifi and fantasy fans), tenforward.social (star trek fans), disabled.social (people who are chronically ill, mentally ill, disabled, and friends/families/allies), mastodon.art (art and creative works of all kinds) who have a list of other creative instances, federatedfandom.net (fannish people and fanfic), furryfediverse.org (a recommended list of instances run by furries for furries), med-mastodon.com (medical community people), mathstodon.xyz (maths people), scholar.social (academia stuff, run by queer academics), and historians.social (mostly academic historians, US biased)


User Interface

Don't like the single or multipane interfaces and want something a bit more familiar/unusual? Then why not try:

  • Phanpy - A modern webclient with a lot of subtle but nice features
  • Halcyon - A webclient built to resemble twitter
  • Brutaldon - a simplistic web 1.0 UI


Glorious Artwork, Addons, and thanks

Our Instance thumbnail is a picture I took of Clougha Pike along with the Mastodon mascot from the default banner.

Our mascot image is provided very helpfully by Sailko under CC BY-SA 3.0, the original is on Mediawiki. It is a Roman Genius Loci medal (see "Ancient Roman medals in the Museo archeologico nazionale (Florence)" and Genius Loci).

We have a relay feed from https://relay.mastodon.host (sadly down), https://relay.libranet.de, and https://mastodon-relay.thedoodleproject.net/.

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

We also use the Drgn Emojis from Volpeon under a Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) license.

Also the OMYA emoji from @victor
Short: This mastodon instance is for friendly people part of, or associated with, the geeky/roleplayer social group of Hanging Town (Lancaster) in the UK.

Description:
Support us

aMastodon.uk is a free service funded by donations from users who can afford to support the costs. Donate using Ko-fi at https://ko-fi.com/amastodon

Community standards

By being friendly and respectful with each other we can create a nice atmosphere on aMastodon.uk

Posting: You can post almost anything you want, but not everything. We expect our community members to abide by the community standards. The rules and community standards apply to both content and behaviour. Our moderators take the context in which posts are written into consideration.

Continuous improvement: The community standards are not fixed, it’s a working document that can be improved upon until we find something that works well. Most things on aMastodon.uk are a work in progress and we’re experimenting with different approaches to build a nice community.

Community timeline: Our community timeline is for genuine human to human interaction. Bots, computers, cross-posters and organisations are encouraged to post in unlisted mode so that only their followers see their posts. Listed posts are those that appear in the community (“local”) and federated timelines. They are publicly visible and followers see them. Unlisted posts does not show up on local and federated timelines, but they can be seen by your followers and are publicly available on your profile page.

Languages: aMastodon.uk is language-specific server with English as the supported language. You can follow people on other servers using other languages but please post in English so that we can moderate fairly.

Automation: To use automated tools, such as cross-posters, please ensure that you are donating monthly to aMastodon.uk Cross posting from other social media sites is allowed when you own both accounts and post in unlisted mode. Cross-posting” is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. If you use apps for manual posting to several platforms simultaneously those posts are considered original and allowed. Bots and semi-automated accounts should be marked as such.

Bots on other servers: May be limited if they post too frequently and suspended if they post too much media. It’s a way to keep costs low and to prioritize genuine human interaction on our server. We may of course revise this moderation policy from time to time. Bots can be very useful, it’s not that we don’t like bots. It’s just about being able to afford them and at the same time offer a good human experience.

Organisations: It’s important to use an official e-mail when you create an organisation account. If there is a mismatch between the e-mail used for sign-up and the organisation name, the account may be considered spam and suspended. For example when the e-mail is name@gmail.com or name@yahoo.com instead of name@your-organisation.com. Get in touch if you have questions or if your account has been erroneously suspended. Try to find the right tone and frequency while posting and consider posting just once or twice a day, alternatively post in unlisted mode for more frequent posts.

Nudity: All content must be suitable to an audience from 16 years old. Mild nudity such as a photo of a statue or an old oil painting is probably going to be okay. Sexually explicit content isn’t allowed.

Zero-advertising: There is zero-advertising. You can not pay us to display ads on the community timeline. Organisations can post anything they want in unlisted mode, so that only their followers and profile-page visitors see it. The rule of thumb is that marketing material shouldn’t be visible to community members, unless they already follow your account.

Federation: aMastodon.uk suspend some servers which are not aligned with our community standards and rules. We’re generally not publishing the list of blocked servers as we don’t want to give those who harass people or host illegal content any attention. You can ask our moderators in a direct message if you want to know if a specific server is suspended.

Excessive posting: Some users on other servers post with a high frequency, there are bots posting every 10 minutes every day. When people on aMastodon.uk follow high frequency posters that content is pulled into our servers. For capacity and economical reasons we may suspend high frequency people and bots, particularly if they are on other servers and followed by inactive users on our server. This is just to keep our costs under control. If our club members want us to unsuspend any such bots we may be able to do so, unless there are issues with them violating other rules.

Flooding the feed: Avoid flooding the community timeline or the home feed of your followers by posting super many posts in a row. Typically some kind of balance is best. Context is important too, sometimes it’s okay to post a lot.

Friendly and respectful atmosphere: Some content is legal but may be removed anyway if it’s suspected to be inauthentic, inflammatory, spammy or misinformation.

Political activism: We welcome political groups from established political parties.

Political extremism: Advocacy of political extremism from either far-left of far-right side of the spectrum may be limited or removed. Particularly if the activism is borderline illegal or focused on revolutionary change by fighting and violence. Civilized discussions may be allowed, it’s the propaganda we want to avoid.

Religious content: You’re welcome to be religious and express that. You’re welcome to celebrate your religious holidays and traditions. But respect other peoples religion. If your content is focused on converting people it may be limited or removed. If your religious content is inflammatory it may be removed.

Conspiracy theories: Don’t post conspiracy theories.

Shitposting: No “shitposting” is permitted.

Signup-promotion: Don’t sign up with the intention of pulling in content from users on third party servers for promotional purposes. Inactivity in combination with suspected sign-up promotion may have your account and/or the users on the third party servers limited or suspended.

Anti science content: Anti-science content such as anti-vaccine movements, may be removed.

Inauthentic accounts: We may suspend suspected inauthentic accounts, especially if they seem to belong to a web of other inauthentic accounts on other servers. This can happen without e-mail notification, as it makes no sense to notify inauthentic accounts when they are being removed.

Federated content: Our community standards also apply to content that is pulled in from other servers through people following accounts there. Users on our server may be suspended for pulling in too much guideline violating content from other servers. This particularly apply to people who just follow people on other servers without being active on our server by posting or replying to posts.

Disagreement: Do not debate moderation actions in public posts. Direct message our team or use e-mail. We listen and answer questions up to a certain point, not forever.

Inactive accounts: From time to time we may delete accounts that haven’t been used during the last three to six months. The shorter time span could be relevant if the user never participated in the community, for example by never ever posting anything. You’re welcome back if your account has been deleted due to inactivity, but there is no guarantee that we can restore your old username.

Access: The administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user’s access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Data: This site is not meant to be a backup or permanent repository for your information, posts or media. Additionally, your media is being downsized on original upload. You can export your posts, but there might be technical issues, so we recommend that you keep a backup elsewhere
Short: Mastodon is Free, Ad Free, Distributed and Not for Sale. Here we want to provide a supportive and inclusive server instance to help people find their way in this Fediverse.
Частный инстанс Опенхуда.

Description:
HamOnt.social

About HamOnt.social

HamOnt.social is a decentralised, free and open alternative to Twitter based on Mastodon, with a local #HamOnt timeline focused on users in and from the Greater Hamilton (Ontario) area. We are federated with other servers, which you can use to discover interests from everyone on HamOnt.social.

The Greater Hamilton region is situated upon the traditional territories of the Erie, Neutral, Huron-Wendat, Haudenosaunee and Mississaugas people. This land is covered by the Dish With One Spoon Wampum Belt Covenant, which was an agreement between the Haudenosaunee and Anishinaabek to share and care for the resources around the Great Lakes. We further acknowledge that this land is covered by the Between the Lakes Purchase, 1792, between the Crown and the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation.

This server is currently administered by @gumshoe.

Federation philosophy

We defederate from instances that engage in harassment or encourage hate speech.

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "…" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM a moderator.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

File Limits

Photos have a maximum file size of 10MB and videos have a maximum file size of 40MB.

Data Location

HamOnt.social user data is stored within Canada, currently in a server at 151 Front St W in Toronto. This may change but we will do our best to 1) keep things in Canada as much as possible and 2) keep users posted if we need to make big changes to how we store things.

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of hamont.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content may be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Any and all content illegal in Canada
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
  5. Bot policy. Bots are welcome, but please include an owner/contact link and a description of what the bot does.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
Short: Hamilton is Home. A place for communities in and around Hamilton, Ontario, Canada.

Description:
jauntygoat.net is a public participant in the modern federated social media universe ("Fediverse").

Creation was driven by these lofty goals:

  • Privacy, and user-ownership of data.
  • A fundamental opposition to data mining, tracking and treating people are advertising target objects.
  • A belief in freedom of speech, association and expression.
  • An understanding that small communities can self-regulate and deliver excellence towards their members in a way that large-scale advertising engines can't.
  • The world needs more goats, both traditional goats and their antelope-related friends.
Short: Freedom needs horns! An expressive platform for today's modern, privacy-aware goat.

Description:
Donations towards the running and maintenance of the EHR server are very welcome. 

You can donate via OpenCollective at https://opencollective.com/ehr

With recent events on Twitter, we felt it was important to move to and fully embrace Mastodon as a means of supporting our work and the human rights defenders who make real and positive change in their communities. We chose to set up a server which will primarily cater for equality and human rights leaders, activists, campaigners, projects, charities, non-profits and organisations. We welcome those who wish to join us provided they are mindful of the rules to keep members safe. Rules are shown in the 'Server Rules' section below.

While we are open and inclusive and require our members to be likewise, there are some Mastodon servers we have blocked due to their content, the behaviour of their members or the absence of any moderation or an unwillingness to insist their members do not harass, abuse dox, intimidate or threaten others in the Fediverse. Details of the servers blocked are shown in the 'Moderated Servers' section below.

 

Other Mastodon servers for equality and human rights leaders, activists, campaigners, projects, charities, non-profits and organisations:


Campaign Openworlds - https://campaign.openworlds.info
Short: A inclusive server for intersectionalist equality and human rights leaders, activists, campaigners, projects, charities, non-profits and organisations #humanrights #equality #diversity.
A pachyderm-offshoot BBiz Community

Description:
argon.city guidelines

Greetings, programs! Welcome to argon.city! This is a Mastodon/Hometown instance run by Daneel Cayce (@sysop) for their friends. Any moderation decisions or administrative actions are at their sole discretion.

This document is a work in progress and will likely change in the future as argon.city evolves. Server announcements will be posted whenever it's updated.

The basics

Harassment and hateful conduct isn't tolerated on this server. That can look like some of these things (a non-exhaustive list):

  • derogatory comments toward someone's gender, race, orientation, disability, neurotype, or appearance
  • threats or intimidation
  • encouraging others to harass someone
  • continuing to initiate contact after a boundary has been drawn (i.e., being asked to stop, having been blocked, etc)

Several Mastodon instances are filtered (meaning that their posts do not appear unless you're following them directly) or blocked for reports of hateful conduct or spam. If you find yourself unable to follow an account and feel that you should be able to, ping @sysop and we'll talk about it.

Best practices

Here are some things you can do to help everyone have a good time around Argon City (and the fediverse at large).

  1. Add image descriptions for folks who use screen readers. The web interface and most apps make this pretty easy!

  2. Use content warnings on the following:

    • NSFW/explicit content
    • Common triggers
    • Posts with a lot of emoji (i.e., Wordle/other game results). These are otherwise difficult for screen reader users!
    • Content warnings are also useful for other potentially-sensitive content, as well as things like ventposts and spoilers for recent media. Use your best judgement -- but please err on the side of caution. If you think something could potentially use a CW, throw it on there.

  3. Current best practice for replies is to set them to "unlisted" (the unlocked padlock icon). This makes your reply visible to everyone, but doesn't clog up the public timelines.


Privacy Policy

The server argon.city runs on is hosted and managed by fedi.monster. The only time they'll share our instance info with a third party is if I sign off on it (which I won't).

The instance itself is part of the "fediverse" -- our public posts are visible to other Mastodon servers. Because of this, if you want to keep your posts private, your best bet is to lock your account, so you approve your followers manually, and either post only to followers or the local server.
Short: Greetings, programs! Welcome to Argon City! This server is a space for Daneel and friends to hang out. <3

Description:
本站介绍

EV Mastodon 是众多 Mastodon 实例中的一个，Mastodon 是一个开源的去中心化社交网络，整个 Mastodon 的社交网络由无数的在线实例组成。注册本站之后不仅可以和本实例的用户互动，也可以与其他全世界各地的实例用户互动。

请心怀善意与人交流。如果时间线上出现您不希望看到的内容，请优先使用「隐藏」、「屏蔽」功能。

对如下的内容请随时发起「举报」

  • 禁止任何攻击或侮辱性的言论
  • 禁止推广虚假内容或发布重复推广内容
  • 禁止违反伦理道德及社会共识的内容（真实的强奸、儿童色情等）
  • 只要涉及成人内容，包括文字及媒体，均需使用恰当的 CW 标签及隐藏内容警告

对于任何违反如上社区规则的账号都会予以一次警告，如警告次数超过三次则会禁用用户账号。

使用指南

  • Mastodon 官方中文文档

本站提供数据导出，直接点击 此链接 ，等待一段时间就可以收到邮件。具体操作步骤可以参考官网。

服务承诺

本实例不会将任何私人信息分享给第三方服务，但本实例没有禁用搜索引擎爬虫，所以也需要每一位用户自己做好隐私保护。

本实例部署在德国黑森林法兰克福，受到德国及欧盟法律的保护。本站所有媒体文件也都存储在欧盟境内，CDN 由 Cloudflare 提供支持。

本实例所有数据都会在北京时间凌晨 2 点进行整站备份。

捐助渠道

  • https://ko-fi.com/einverne
  • https://www.buymeacoffee.com/einverne
  • GitHub Sponsor
Short: EV Mastodon 是一个开源的、去中心化社交网络，本站提供了一个可以自由讨论的网络空间。

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of oldinternet.net; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Description:
【案内】
1.アカウント登録は招待制です。登録を希望する場合はメンバーに招待を依頼してください。依頼されたメンバーはその旨を事前に通達して頂けるとスムーズに対応できます。

-2.メールアドレス、パスワード両方を忘れてしまった場合は運営者にお知らせください。パスワード変更メールを登録されたメールアドレスに送信します。

-3.インスタンスに接続できない場合は、Discord(https://discord.gg/ExRtGec7w9)など他のサービスで報告してください。

【ルール】
-1.みんななかよく

-2.以下の事項に該当する、もしくは事前に該当すると判断された場合は、アカウントの作成を拒否、またアカウントを停止します。
--2-1.スパム等の迷惑サイトの宣伝、誘導。
--2-2.嫌がらせやストーカー、誹謗中傷等の迷惑行為。
--2-3.その他の懸念事項により、インスタンスへの参加が相応しくないと判断された場合。

-3.基本的に当インスタンスでは言論、自己表現の自由を保障します。ただし、以下のような投稿を禁止します。
--3-1.個人または集団に攻撃・危害を加える事を目的とする圧力行為、またはその内容。
--3-2.他人の表現・行動を著しく萎縮・貶める内容。
--3-3.意図的に他人を不快にさせる内容。

-4.これらのルールに違反すると思われる投稿を見かけた場合は通報してください。通報内容は運営者・モデレーターにのみ通知されます。
--4-1.ルール違反や、乗っ取りなどセキュリティ安全上などの問題により、該当する投稿を告知なく非公開にする場合があります。
--4-2.度重なる違反が見られるユーザーには注意や警告を行いますが、それでも改善が見られない場合には利用を制限します。
--4-3.通報はただちに運営者・モデレーターによって受理され、慎重に審議されます。

上記のルールはkimpireの当Mastodonにおいてのみ適用されます。ただし、kimpireの各サービス上でのルール違反等の状況によって、全ての利用を制限する場合があります。
Use of the Mastodon server implies alignment with our Community Code of Conduct

Description:
Mastodon es una red social libre, federada y descentralizada que, junto con otros muchos productos, forma parte del fediverso. Cada usuario elige en qué servidor registrarse, bajo qué reglas, y cómo interactúa con los demás miembros. Algunos, incluso, ejecutan sus propios servidores, y es exactamente lo que he hecho yo.

Funcionamiento básico de mastodon (gracias, comunidad.nvda.es por permitir usar el contenido)

Seguramente te han dicho que Mastodon es una alternativa a Twitter, y eso te hace pensar que son muy parecidos. Si bien es cierto que tienen sus similitudes, también hay notables diferencias que no se pueden pasar por alto. Aquí te dejo algunos consejos para empezar:

Los nombres de usuario son como en Twitter, pero sólo si mencionas a personas de tu instancia. De lo contrario, hay que añadir el dominio al que pertenecen cuando quieras mencionarlos. Por ejemplo, jpavonabian@mst.universoalterno.es.

El buscador está muy limitado, no esperes encontrar resultados de todo el fediverso con él. No obstante, podrás usarlo con total seguridad para escribir nombres de usuario o explorar una publicación cuya URL tienes. En las instancias que no tienen soporte ElasticSearch, sus posibilidades se ven aún más restringidas (esta instancia sí lo tiene).

Un Me gusta es un reconocimiento al usuario que ha escrito una publicación. Lo verá porque le le llegará una notificación, y el toot se guardará en tus favoritos, pero no se difundirá. Si quieres difundir una publicación, usa siempre el botón Retootear, Boostear, Impulsar, o como se llame en tu interfaz.

Usa los marcadores para guardar una publicación sin notificar al autor. Nadie podrá ver tus marcadores.

Existen varias líneas temporales:

  • Inicio, donde ves la actividad de la gente a la que sigues, incluyendo las interacciones entre ellos y sus retoots. Los mensajes directos también aparecerán en Inicio.
  • Notificaciones: aquí aparecerá cualquier interacción contigo: retoots, menciones, mensajes directos, personas que te siguen o marcan como favorito uno de tus toots.
  • Local: contiene los toots públicos de los miembros de la instancia, y sólo los toots. No incluye menciones o retoots.
  • Federada: contiene los toots locales, y los toots de todos los usuarios de otras instancias seguidos por usuarios de tu instancia. La línea federada es un buen lugar en el que encontrar gente conocida, y conocer gente nueva. Procura no perderla de vista. Si la instancia se conecta a un repetidor, como es nuestro caso, la federada es una combinación de las federadas de todas las instancias unidas a ese repetidor.
  • Mensajes directos: contiene los mensajes directos agrupados en conversaciones. Hay cuatro tipos de publicaciones:
    • Pública: llega a todas partes. Aparece en la línea local y la federada.
    • No listada: no se muestra en las líneas local y federada, pero cualquiera que abra tu perfil o te siga la encontrará.
    • Sólo seguidores: sólo las personas que te siguen podrán leerla.
    • Directa: sólo la persona o personas mencionadas podrán leerla. Es muy fácil enviar mensajes directos grupales.

Los mensajes directos no van cifrados. Los administradores de las instancias involucradas en una conversación podrían leerlos si quisieran. No envíes información que consideres confidencial.

Explora las tendencias disponibles para encontrar personas con tus mismos intereses. Sigue al administrador de tu instancia, y procura respetar las reglas. Si no te convencen, siempre puedes migrar a otra instancia más adecuada para ti.

Los recursos no son ilimitados. Para alargar la vida de la instancia y facilitar su administración, configura un umbral de eliminación automática de publicaciones en las opciones de tu cuenta. Te lo agradeceré infinitamente.

Si quieres que los demás te encuentren con facilidad, no descuides tu perfil. La casilla "Sugerir esta cuenta a otros" es especialmente interesante, y viene desmarcada por defecto.

Describe cualquier contenido multimedia que subas. No sólo imágenes, también audios y vídeos. Nunca se sabe quién podría necesitar una buena descripción.

Si quieres redactar un hilo, responde a tu publicación anterior, y así sucesivamente. Procura poner el primer toot como público, y el resto como no listados.

Mastodon tiene una app oficial para móviles, pero no pienses que por ello está mejor preparada u ofrece funciones únicas. Hay aplicaciones de terceros que te pueden venir mejor, dales una oportunidad.

Si crees que una de tus publicaciones puede herir la sensibilidad de alguien, marca la casilla de contenido sensible y escribe un breve texto de advertencia. Aunque en otras redes sociales no has pagado nada, nunca fueron gratis. Mastodon tampoco lo es. Pregunta al administrador de tu instancia si necesita dinero para financiarla y, si es así, intenta contribuir en la medida de tus posibilidades. Tristemente, dejar atrás algoritmos y publicidad tiene sus consecuencias.

Mastodon con lectores de pantallas (gracias, comunidad.nvda.es por permitir usar el contenido)

Si tus ojos se encuentran fuera de servicio permanentemente, seguramente estarás usando uno o varios lectores de pantalla. Sigue estas recomendaciones para sacarle todo el partido posible a Mastodon:

En las preferencias de tu cuenta, activa la vista avanzada. A continuación, despliega tantos hilos como quieras, y fíjalos. Para ello, abre la configuración que se encuentra bajo el encabezado de nivel 1 en cada uno.

Olvídate del cursor virtual o el modo exploración. Puede que tengas que emplearlo, pero en casos muy puntuales. Apóyate en el modo foco, las flechas y los diversos atajos de teclado de Mastodon. Estando en modo foco, pulsa el signo cerrar interrogación, pasa al modo exploración y pulsa la t para ir a la siguiente tabla. Allí verás todas las teclas rápidas.

Si tienes iPhone o Mac, instala Mona o metatext. Se tratan de aplicaciones muy completa y accesibles con VoiceOver. También dispones de otras apps que puedes probar, como Tusker o IceCubes.

Si tienes Android, instala Tusky, Megalodon o Fedilab. Esta última es de pago.

En Windows, puedes usar TWBlue. La línea federada deberás habilitarla desde Opciones de cuenta, en la pestaña buffers.

En cualquier plataforma, también tienes a tu disposición el cliente web Semaphore, un cliente web centrado en la accesibilidad.
Short: Bienvenido al Universo Alterno. otra instancia general.

Description: the fifth era of cathoderay.tube
Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server
When life is a highway...

ここは何ぞ?

日本の一般人による，一般人のためのMastodonインスタンスです。

  • 青い鳥や，濃いヲタたちとの交流に疲れた一般人。
  • FreeBSDについて，もっと知りたい一般人。
  • 写真の腕を上げたい一般人。
  • 異性装を楽しむ一般人。
  • 日焼け肌が大好きな一般人。
  • 年中発情期な一般人。
  • 甘辛くおしゃれしたい一般人。
  • 飯テロを投下しまくりたい一般人。
  • 最近ヲタ卒した一般人。
  • なぜか，オタクや変態と間違われやすい一般人。
  • 推しが卒業して，暇になった一般人。

いろんな一般人が，思い思いにつぶやく場です。どっかの商用SNSみたいな，言論統制はしないよん♪

何ができる?

1回500文字以内でつぶやいて，様々なMastodonや互換インスタンス (Misskey, Pleroma等) のユーザーと交流できます。つぶやきには静止画，動画，音声も添付できます。

…と云われると，たいていの方は “Twitterとほとんど一緒” と思われるかもしれませんが，半分以上正解です。大きい違いは, “サービス全体を1つの会社が握っているわけではない” 点です。インスタンスごとに管理者がいて，ここのように個人運営だったり，どこかの企業がやっていたりと様々です。集まるユーザーの趣向やポリシーもまちまちです。

白林檎は2019年春からMastodonを使っており，一般人の目線で “ヲタヲタしい人々，とくにICTと2次元寄りが多いなー” と感じていました。一般人やヲタ卒した人々が気軽に参加しやすい，日本人向けのインスタンスを探しましたが，見当たらなかったので自宅のサーバーに建てました。

参加資格

次をお持ちの方なら，どなたでも登録・利用できます。

  • 標準的な日本語の読み書き能力。
  • こちらから送信可能なメールアドレス。
  • 自分は一般人である，またはこれから一般人になる，と云う信念。

お願い

最低限，次だけ守っていただけると，白林檎も周りも助かります。

禁止事項

悪質な場合は当該のユーザーへ警告し，改善されなければアカウントの停止，削除を行います。

  • 特定の個人や団体をぶっ叩くつぶやき。
    正当な批判は，もちろんありです。自分が気に入らん等の理由で，一方的にけなしたりするのはNG。
  • 法に反するつぶやき。
    ヤクの取引とか，公にしてはいけない機密情報とか，陰部が見えるエロ画像とか，そのへんですね。エロ画像の陰部の修正は，同人イベントで頒布したり，同人作品のダウンロードサイトに掲載したりできる程度のものをお願いします。
  • 極端な連投。
    例えば専用のプログラムから毎秒つぶやくなど，一般人がPCやスマートフォン等の通常の操作でできるとは思えないほど短い間隔で連続投稿されると，サーバーと回線に無駄な負荷がかかり，他のユーザーの使用に差し支えてしまいます。
  • 大きすぎるファイルの添付。
    40 MiB以下を目安としてください。

CW, 閲覧注意の活用

エロい画像・文章・URLや長文をつぶやく際は，投稿欄下部の [CW] や，ファイルをアップロードした後に表示されるチェックボックス [メディアを閲覧注意にする] をONにしていただけると，外出先でつぶやきを読む人々は安心できたりします。
Short: 日本の一般人向けのMastodonインスタンス。
Python Asia Mastodon is a community of Python users and developers within the Asia region.

Description:
Expectations for people on this server

  1. This server is invite-only, consisting of people who are part of a community of transportation advocates centered in the Bay Area, who also know each other off of the Internet. If you know people on this server IRL, you can ask for an invite.
  2. We don’t tolerate any form of reactionary bigotry: no nazis, no TERFs or transphobes, no racists, etc.
  3. Generally, treat people within this server and related communities with respect. Rule 2 is higher priority than this rule. We also don’t expect you to be polite to, say, someone being racist. But if you make well-moderated servers that we have close ties with want to defederate with us, consider how you are affecting other people on the server.
  4. Most of us are somewhere on the left politically. We don’t have strong ideological requirements, but if your politics are far from those of people on the server, this might not be the server for you.
  5. We mostly want to reduce the use of cars and replace them with better forms of transportation. We don’t require you to be totally car free to use this server, but you should be on board with reducing car dependency.

Content warnings

Please put images of violence (e.g. a video of you being hit by a car) behind a CW.

Similarly, anything that would be uncomfortable to show up on your feed on, say, the bus, should be behind a CW.

In general though we see content warnings as a tool that you may choose to use in different ways. Someone may choose to put something behind a CW, but you don’t have to. In particular, you might see someone putting their personal experiences of experiencing racism behind a content warning, but that does not mean that it’s an expectation of this server.

Server Administration

The plan is to keep the server up indefinitely. Currently two people have access to the server infrastructure, and the intention is that there will always be at least two people who can run the server.

If circumstances change and it becomes necessary to entirely shut it down, we will give three months notice. If it makes sense, and the members of the server are fine with that, we would be willing to transfer ownership to a member of the server instead.

In general, we aim to make server decisions by consensus, and allow people to be as involved in the running of the server as they want to be.

Defederation policies

We will make any new and unexpected decisions by consensus, but to avoid having a discussion every time something comes up, we have already decided anyone can defederate from servers that are a danger to the people on the server or the server infrastructure. This includes:

  • Servers that permit CSAM (child sexual abuse material) or content that resembles such
  • Servers that host fascists or other political movements that are actively hostile and dangerous to our members
  • Servers that host malware, conduct DDOS attacks, or otherwise interfere with the functioning of this server
  • So-called “free speech” servers or servers with such poor moderation that they effectively fall into one of the previous categories
Short: A community of people who are fighting against car dominance in San Francisco and beyond and also have various other interests.

Description:
The Petrous.Vislae.Town Code of Conduct

We want this to be a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If someone asks you to leave them alone, leave them alone.

Unacceptable Behavior

The following behavior is not welcome anywhere on Petrous:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion.
  • Holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism.
  • Promotion of fascist, supremacist, or hateful ideology or symbolism, including in choice of user name or avatar.
  • Deliberate or persistent misgendering.
  • Threats of violence.
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • Deliberate intimidation.
  • Publishing any individual's address, phone number, or other private identifying information without consent.
  • Sexual depictions of children.
  • Unwelcome sexual attention, including sharing sexual content with specific users without consent.
  • Gratuitous sexual images or behavior without a content warning.
  • Simulated physical contact (e.g. textual descriptions like “hug” or “backrub”) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication without consent.
  • Sustained disruption of discussion.
  • Continued communications with someone who's asked that you leave them alone.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person’s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.

The following behavior is not allowed on the public timeline:

  • Graphic violent or sexual content without a content warning
  • Gratuitous advertising or spam. It's fine to promote your work, but it shouldn't be the bulk of what you share.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the admins may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from this instance and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom we've received complaints.

Credits and License

This code of conduct is a search & replace of Wandering Shop's elegant Code of Conduct which in turn is based on Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy.

Contributing

In the unlikely event you'd like to help me keep doing this, I'm accepting contributions at ko-fi for keeping petrous online.
Short: It's just Binder's place. If you don't know who that is, you're probably in the wrong place.
Ein kleiner Server für die #SchleFaZ Gemeinde.

Description:
Blatantly cribb'ed from rage.love's CoC:

We have enough of all the systematic bias that destroy lives.
We had enough of the patriarchy.
We had enough of the colonialism and the racism.
We had enough of the capitalistic system.
No TERF, no SWERF, no Nazi, no Centrist
We care for each other
We care for the living
We care for the land
We remember who we lost and what they fought for

Rules and Etiquette

Welcome! Please feel free to join us here, if you do, know that we ask everyone to keep a few things in mind. The following list is not exhaustive, and will be modified and expanded over time. Look, if you get it and you you're good with it, great. If you don't get it, figure it out - we can help! If you don't want to get it, maybe find somewhere else to hang your hat.

Be you

This is a space to celebrate our diversity. Here you don't need to be a brand, be true to yourself and let others do the same.

Cultivate a Safe Atmosphere

Harassment will not be tolerated, oppressive behavior will not be tolerated, and while failure to recognize the boundaries of others may be met at first with a gentle attempt to educate you, repeated failure will not be tolerated.

Share Things

Talk about what you are up to! Talk to other people about what they are up to! Make things! Share you patreon! Post your art! Share your knowledge! ask the questions that keep you awake at night.

Banal Bullshit Unwelcome
There's nothing interesting about homophobia, transphobia, racism, sexism or any of the other unexamined default settings some people grow up with. Being a nazi isn't an opinion, it's shitty and aggressively boring - take it somewhere else. You can feel free to disagree somewhere else where none of us have to hear you. Similarly, cryptocurrency and NFTs are bullshit and considered harmful. Keep 'em out. Enforced strictly.
Elon Musk Apologists will be tolerated but expect to be mocked.


Standing on the Shoulders of Giants

Rules, Etiquette, Bots, block list

We are very thankful to other community like weirder.earth and sleeping.town and rage.love and the people running them. They allow people to use their extensive rules, policies and hard gained knowledge about unsafe communities out there.

The current moderation is done by 1 low-spoon admin. Allow 24 hours for answers, actions and replies .

To report a toot, click the "3" dots menu and click report. It will allow you to select one or more toot. You'll also be able to add a note for the moderator(s) to see.

We will suspend any instance launched, acquired or funded by Alphabet, Facebook, Twitter, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Elsevier or similar corporation.
Short: Boostin' Toots & Tootin' Boston. Slow growth, small instance. Northeast United States of America.
Una pequeña instancia desfederada para un grupo de amigos.
给喜欢民主自由的人一个玩耍的空间

Description:
About This Place

I didn't like the other Mastodon servers. Also, they were slow. I want to hang with all my friends from online and real life. Feel free to talk music, art, culture, figure skating, etc. Laffs and laughs welcome. No jerks or creeps allowed.

Accounts

Accounts are invite-only at the discretion of Spaceball's admin (@thisismariat). This is a small instance and I don't have a lot of open slots.

Moving & Closing Accounts

If you find that you aren't going to use your account very much, or feel you might get more out of a different instance, by all means, feel free to migrate or close your account. This will allow me to offer up a space. Just drop me a line (maria+mastodon@plainparade.org) and let me know?

How to Support This Instance

This is a small instance and I am fortunate to be in a position where paying for it out of pocket is not a financial strain.

That said, if you wish to make a contribution to hosting, I have set up the following make this easy:

  1. Visit my Buy Me A Coffee page, which can be found here or in my Mastodon profile
  2. Navigate to the "Membership" tab and select the "Mastodon Server Accounts" level
  3. Enter your account handle in the "Name" field
  4. Select "Make this message private" and checkout

Code of Conduct

Those on Spaceballs agree to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.

Except for Nazis and other hate-spewing types. We will not be tolerant of you.

What Does That Mean?

Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our community include:

  • Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people
  • Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences
  • Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback
  • Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes, and learning from the experience
  • Focusing on what is best not just for us as individuals, but for the overall community

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

  • Unwanted sexual attention or advances of any kind
  • Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
  • Public or private harassment
  • Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or email address, without their explicit permission
  • Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting

Who's Responsible?

Spaceball's admin (@thisismariat) is responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any behavior that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.

Spaceball's admin (@thisismariat) has the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate reasons for moderation decisions when appropriate.

How to Report An Incident

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported to the Spaceballs admin at maria+mastodon@plainparade.org. All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.

Admins are obligated to respect the privacy and security of the reporter of any incident.

Our Enforcement Process

In the event that something becomes an issue, Spaceball's admin (@thisismariat) will follow these guidelines in determining the consequences for any action they deem in violation of this Code of Conduct:

  1. Correction: A private, written warning from the Spaceballs admin, providing clarity around the nature of the violation and an explanation of why the behavior was inappropriate. A public apology may be requested.
  2. Warning: A warning with consequences for continued behavior. No interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, for a specified period of time. This includes avoiding interactions in community spaces as well as external channels like social media. Violating these terms may lead to a temporary or permanent ban.
  3. Temporary Ban: A temporary ban from any sort of interaction or public communication with the community for a specified period of time. No public or private interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, is allowed during this period. Violating these terms may lead to a permanent ban.
  4. Permanent Ban: A permanent ban from any sort of public interaction within the community.
Short: I didn't like the other Mastodon servers. I wanted to hang with all my friends from online and real life. Laffs and laughs welcome. No jerks or creeps allowed.

Description:
Welcome!

This is the official MajorsHouse network Mastodon instance!

It was created shortly after Twitter was taken over by Musky Musk, but had existed in one form or another before then.

While the creation of this server might seem reactionary, in truth, it was something that was planned some time ago, but the timetable for launch got pushed once the aforementioned event occured.

If you'd like to help support this instance, you can support our founder, Marcus "MajorLinux" Summers at the following places:

https://ko-fi.com/majorlinux https://patreon.com/majorlinux hhtps://paypal.me/majorlinux
Short: This is the Mastodon instance for the MajorsHouse Network!

Description: Friends and Family Federated Social Media
Short: Faf Social

Description:
This server is home to ChiefGyk3D and his diverse network of friends and collaborators who share a passion for innovation, learning, and technology. Registration is by invitation only, ensuring a dedicated and engaged community.

Our community values respect, inclusivity, and civil discourse. We are a mostly chill group, weary of the toxic environments prevalent on many platforms. Bigotry, hate speech, and any form of discrimination are not tolerated here. While we welcome robust debates and intellectual exchanges, we expect all members to conduct these discussions in a respectful and considerate manner.

The people on this server come from a wide array of professional backgrounds, with a particular emphasis on 3D printing, Cybersecurity, Finance, InfoSec, Homelabbing, Linux, and IT. We pride ourselves on our multifaceted interests and expertise, fostering an environment of collaboration, growth, and discovery.

Our community also includes an array of content creators, with many having roots in platforms like TikTok and beyond. We celebrate this diversity of voices and perspectives, and we welcome the creative spirit it brings to our server.

Many of us are deeply involved in the cryptocurrency and Web3 space, maintaining an educational focus on projects and NFTs with utility. While we acknowledge the financial potential these areas offer, we're keen to avoid a culture of chasing profits, instead promoting an understanding and appreciation of the underlying technology.

Here at ChiefGyk3D's server, we believe in Peace, Love, and Technology! We warmly invite our members to share their experiences, grow their knowledge, and contribute to our vibrant, tech-driven community.
Short: This is a private Mastodon server for ChiefGyk3D and his friends. We are a group of people who like technology at various levels. No bigotry, no hate speech, no scams, just good vibes and fun.
A community of Christians who engage constructively, as explicitly as Christians, on the climate crisis and the other major global challenges of humanity.

Description:
Welcome to Ceilidh.Online

I am Tiesa Meskis, the owner and primary administrator of this instance, and I am a transgender woman who is actively involved in the LGBTQIA+ community. Open Source flows through my veins as I have worked with numerous projects since 1992ish. I chose the name Ceilidh, pronounced Kay-lee, from the Gaelic language as it means Social Gathering. My goals for this site are to offer a place where people can take part in the greater #Fediverse and have a say in the policies of the instance. The initial rules that I have come up with are based on acceptable use from other instances and I intend to add and update rules as needed and with the approval of those using this instance.

Please donate if you are able

Usage of this instance will always be free and no features will ever be locked behind a paywall. Even so, it does take time and money to keep things going and this is the only place where you will be asked for help to pay the bills. Our goal is to use 1/3 of any donations to split between the open-source initiatives that keep our instance going. The remainder will be used to maintain and upgrade resources and probably buy the admins and mods a beverage of their choice now and then. Please use the following links to make a donation that works for you:

  • Make a one-time donation
  • Become a Monthly Sustaining Member
  • Become an Annual Sustaining Member

Payments are processed through my main business Spectrum Business Technologies using the secure payment processor Stripe. This is to ensure that your payment information is kept safe and secure and with their fee structure, we can use more of the money collected to improve this instance.

How We Intend to Keep Things Running Smoothly

With the influx of new users across the #Fediverse, many instances have gotten overloaded or moderation has become difficult because the number of reports is too much for their moderation team to handle. This is not meant to cast shade on my fellow instance admins, but to explain how it can become overwhelming if a policy is not put into place to keep things in check. This is the policy we currently implement in order to keep things working well:

New Accounts Must Be Approved

As you noticed when you created your account you had to go through a small approval process in order for your account to become active. By doing this we can help weed out those that would try to misuse this instance and limit the total number of users that are actively registered to the instance.

Problematic Instances Will Be Suspended

We keep an eye out for instances that get mentioned using the #Fediblock hashtag. If we know and trust the source of the report then the server is put onto our Suspended list.
Otherwise, we look into the report as we can and make a determination if it is a problematic instance or a handful of users that the instance admins are hopefully in the process of moderating. If we don't see appropriate moderation then the instance will be Suspended.

We Will Actively Moderate Your Reports

We take your reports seriously and will act on them as quickly as is humanly possible. Any reports of a user in this instance being violent to anyone here or elsewhere will result in a suspension while we look into the report and a ban will be put in place should the report be substantiated. Reports of remote users being problematic are extremely helpful as we can determine if it is a single user that is at fault or an entire instance and put controls in place accordingly. If you feel that a moderator is being problematic then please alert one of the Admins as we want to make sure our moderators are being fair and not showing preference.

Modifications to Our Policy Are Ongoing

As this instance grows our policy will need to change in order to be beneficial to all that choose to call this home. Any changes will be done in order to ensure that this space remains welcoming and peaceful. If you feel a policy is problematic then please discuss it with a moderator and we can start a discussion with the rest of the instance so it can be reworked to better fit the needs of all users.
Short: Ceilidh.Online is meant to be a safe gathering place for like-minded people who want to participate in the #Fediverse.

Description:
Willkommen auf ostalb.social

Das ist eine Mastodon-Instanz von der Ostalb für die Ostalb :)

Natürlich dürfen sich auch über die "Landesgrenzen" hinweg Leute, Vereine und Firmen auf dem Server anmelden. Wir bitten nur darum, bei den Sprachen Deutsch und Englisch zu bleiben.

Weiter lohnt sich ein Blick in die Serverregeln, die wir auch sehr strikt anwenden werden.

Bereitgestellt wird die Instanz durch ostalb.cloud, einer Marke von cloud4you. Sie befindet sich im Rechenzentrum der cloud4you AG in Ellwangen.

Wir halten auch die Mastodon Server Vereinbarung (orig. Mastodon Server Covenant) ein, um mit wachsender Größe hoffentlich irgendwann mal als offizieller Server gelistet zu werden.

Description: Code of Conduct: harassment of any protected class is grounds for suspension of your account. Explicit content must be appropriately CWed, and explicit content depicting minors is grounds for suspension of your account and removal of said content. More generally just don't be a dick (admin is final authority on what being a dick is).

Respect and acknowledgement of our shared humanity should be the guiding principle here. Remember that there are fellow human beings behind the other accounts and that what we write and share here does reflect who we are, both individually and as a community.

I created this with the intent of building up an online community for those of us in the greater Albany area to find each other and celebrate (and sometimes grumble about) life in upstate New York.

I hope to add more here as we go, ideally with others' input as well.

We hope to be an online community that serves as a host plant to those who feel they need somewhere to settle and grow in the fediverse and who have some connection to the Albany area or Upstate New York.

Description:
Eligibility

Old Mermaid town welcomes people of any location, ancestry, gender, religion, etc. While the server is located in Sydney, we are not an Australian-focussed instance.

Registrations are currently open. You will need to provide a reason to join, which will be read by a human. Members can also generate invitations.

Terms of service

Many thanks to scholar.social and mastodon.social, from whom I took/adapted many policies.

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of Old Mermaid Town; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  • The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    • Excessive advertising
    • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    • Untagged pornography and sexually explicit content (no matter if photographed or drawn)
    • Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence (no matter if photographed or drawn)
  • The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    • Racism or advocation of racism
    • Sexism or advocation of sexism
    • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
    • Making any kind of Fediverse indexing tool
  • The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    • Sexual depictions of children
    • Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  • Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
    • Any sort of automated scraping of the site for user data.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Rights regarding content on Old Mermaid Town

User-submitted content, including profile information, avatars, uploaded media, posted content, replies and any other information submitted to Old Mermaid Town remain the property of the user who submits it (provided they owned it to begin with). As much as is legally possible given the nature of this service, it is the policy of Old Mermaid Town that users retain complete creative and legal control of their own submitted material.

Emojis

Custom Emojis can be requested by users.

Bots and cross-posters

Old Mermaid Town does not allow bots. We recommend that you put your bot on another instance.

Longevity pledge

Old Mermaid Town is committed to providing long-term service to the academic community, and has no plans to shut down.

In the case that Old Mermaid Town shuts down, users of Old Mermaid Town will be given an advance warning at least six months before the site is closed.

In case of downtime or data loss

While we strive to provide continuous service and avoid errors and data loss, Old Mermaid Town provides no guarantees regarding uptime and cannot be held responsible in the case that account data is lost or corrupted. It is recommended that you export your own data archive periodically. Backing up your account is your own responsibility. Users whose accounts are suspended for breaking our Community Standards will not be given an opportunity to download a copy of their archive.

Does Old Mermaid Town use cookies?

Yes. Cookies are small files that a site or its service provider transfers to your computer's hard drive through your Web browser (if you allow). These cookies enable the site to recognize your browser and, if you have a registered account, associate it with your registered account.

We use cookies to understand and save your preferences for future visits and compile aggregate data about site traffic and site interaction so that we can offer better site experiences and tools in the future.

Do we disclose any information to outside parties?

We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer to outside parties your personally identifiable information for marketing purposes or to generate revenue. We may release your information when we believe release is appropriate to comply with the law, enforce our site policies, or protect ours or others rights, property, or safety. Australian law does not always permit us to tell you if we have released your information to law enforcement; in particular, warrant canaries are illegal in Australia.

We are hosted on Linode in Sydney, Australia. Media is stored on Linode in Singapore.

Use of Old Mermaid Town for research

Researchers who wish to study Old Mermaid Town or our users by collecting data using the API or through any other means that does not involve an "opt-in" from individual users are required to submit their protocol, analysis plan and all relevant ethics approval documentation from their institutional review board or departmental internal review documentation by email to: deb at mermaid.town. You may also be required to submit code you plan to execute so that it can be tested to ensure it does not degrade the quality of service to other users.

This does not apply to, e.g. surveys circulated on Old Mermaid Town that individual users can consent to participating in. However, this does apply to database scraping software, or any means of recording user activity where our users might be surprised that they were included afterward, because they were not given a chance to consent.

At the admin's discretion, you may be asked to submit your research protocol, and the institution that is providing ethical review, even in the case that it is an opt-in survey. Failure to disclose your research plan may result in closure of your account, or having your network banned from our service.

Old Mermaid Town instance blocking policy

Old Mermaid Town will suspend other instances in cases where an instance publishes material that is illegal for us to publish.

Instances that consist entirely of spam-bots, follow-bots, or who appear to be scraping the Fediverse or doing other potentially malicious data-mining will be suspended.

Blocking of other instances will also occur in cases where another instance's policies are fundamentally at odds with those of Old Mermaid Town. This includes, but is not limited to: explicit anti-queer hate/racism/sexism, the embracing of Nazi hate, exploitative depictions of children, toleration of harassment, etc.

Other instances may also be blocked in cases where the admin of another instance has abdicated responsibility for moderating their users' behaviour, either in a public statement or on their instance "about" page.

Old Mermaid town has the AUTHORIZED_FETCH option turned on. Posts made here will not be federated to blocked instances through transitive boosting on intervening instances.

Credits

Banner art by Alethea. Mascot art by Annie".
Short: A Hometown instance for fish out of water.
