Description:
Welcome to meh.

meh.social (or meh social or mehstodon) is an instance aimed at being a refuge from the loss of a certain social network's stability, and being a safe haven for those who wish to engage in social media without all the algorithms.

Code of Conduct

We want this to be a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If someone asks you to leave them alone, leave them alone.

Unacceptable Behavior

The following behavior is not welcome anywhere on meh.social:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion.
  • Holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism.
  • Promotion of fascist, supremacist, or hateful ideology or symbolism, including in choice of user name or avatar.
  • Deliberate or persistent misgendering.
  • Threats of violence.
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • Deliberate intimidation.
  • Publishing any individual's address, phone number, or other private identifying information without consent. (Also known as doxxing)
  • Sexual depictions of children.
  • Unwelcome sexual attention, including sharing sexual content with specific users without consent.
  • Gratuitous sexual images or behavior without a content warning.
  • Simulated physical contact (e.g. textual descriptions like “hug” or “backrub”) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication without consent.
  • Sustained disruption of discussion.
  • Continued communications with someone who's asked that you leave them alone.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person’s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.

The following behavior is not allowed on the public timeline:

  • Graphic violent or sexual content without a content warning
  • Excessive advertising or spam. It's fine to promote your work, but it shouldn't be the bulk of what you share.

Known Harassers:

The admins may ban or silence users whom we know to be harassers or abusers, even if they have not violated the rules of this instance. The mere presence of a harasser can make past or potential victims uncomfortable, and it can put potential victims who are unaware of the person's history in particular danger. Users are encouraged to individually mute, block, and/or report accounts they don't want to see, but at our discretion, we may take the additional step of blocking or silencing someone instance-wide if we believe they endanger the safe and welcoming space we're trying to maintain.

Reporting

The current admin is:

  • Timcade

While we currently have no moderators, this will change as our instance grows, and moderators will be identified here.

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact an admin or a moderator. They'll respond as promptly as they can.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom we’ve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the admins may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from meh social and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom we've received complaints.

Be aware that not every user or post you see in your timeline is a member registered on meh.social. Users of meh social itself are expected to adhere to this CoC, and may expect to be engaged in respectful dialogue with an admin or moderator if there is any indication that transgressions were a mistake or lapse. Users from other instances may not feel bound by our CoC terms, but violations from non-local accounts will not receive further grace in moderation decisions.

DMCA / Copyright Concerns

If you have a DMCA/copyright complaint to file, please send an email to timcade@meh.social. Please ensure your complaint is filled out exactly as stated below, or it will be ignored:

  • The name, address, and physical or electronic signature of the complaining party
  • Identification of the infringing materials and their internet location (e.g. a url)
  • Sufficient information to identify the copyrighted works
  • A statement by the copyright holder of a good faith belief that there is no legal basis for the use complained of
  • A statement of the accuracy of the notice and, under penalty of perjury, that the complaining party is authorized to act on the behalf of the copyright holder

Credits and License

This code of conduct is based on Wandering Shop's Code of Conduct, which is based off Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy. Thanks so much to The Wandering Shop for the permission to use your rules as a basis for our own instance!

Logo is created by @jankhambrams@meh.social - an incredible artist and excellent human. Follow them!
Short: This is meh. Seriously. When our favorite social networks dissolve, don't we want our own space?

Description:
This is a small, friends-oriented server run by Stephen Brennan. Here's some quick info about the server.

Approval is required to create an account. I'll only approve new accounts from people I know or have a good reason to accept. If you don't know me, you'll have to make a pretty good case.

I run this server on my own dime and time. I'll do my best to regularly keep things up-to-date with security updates and reboots. There's one machine so that means there will be occasional downtime. Sorry!

Keep in mind that I'm your server admin, and I have access to all your toots - even private DMs. Of course, I'm not seeking anything out, in fact I promise never to look at anything in the database except for the purposes of diagnostics and support. But it would be wise for you to not post anything sensitive, regardless of the privacy level. Further, privacy levels are "advisory" at best. If your message leaves this server (e.g. you set it to "followers-only" and you have a follower on a different server) then that server's admin can read your toots, and their software could disregard your privacy level entirely. So again, just be wise how you use this service.
Short:
Welcome to 🐍.club! This is a friends-only Mastodon server hosted by Stephen (@brenns10). You're probably here because some dude named Stephen told you that Elon Musk sucks and you should get a Mastodon account. Please be nice while you're here, don't be spammy, and we'll get along great.

(Please note that we are not in any way affiliated with any NFT going by a similar name to this domain.)
Hosted in Melbourne Australia, this server is for anyone! There's a particular focus on photography the geeky things, but all are welcome.

Description:
robot.rodeo Code of Conduct.

Be patient and kind.

Be inclusive.

We welcome and support people of all backgrounds and identities. This includes, but is not limited to members of any sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, race, ethnicity, culture, national origin, social and economic class, educational level, color, immigration status, sex, age, size, family status, political belief, religion, and mental and physical ability.

Be considerate.

We all depend on each other. Your decisions will affect everyone on this instance, and you should take those consequences into account when making posts.

Be respectful.

We won't all agree all the time, but disagreement is no excuse for disrespectful behavior. We will all experience frustration from time to time, but we cannot allow that frustration to become personal attacks. An environment where people feel uncomfortable or threatened is not a productive or creative one.

Choose your words carefully.

Be kind to others. Do not insult or put down others. Harassment and exclusionary behavior aren't acceptable. This includes, but is not limited to: - Threats of violence. - Discriminatory jokes and language. - Sharing sexually explicit or violent material. - Personal insults, especially those using racist or sexist terms. - Unwelcome sexual attention. - Advocating for, or encouraging, any of the above behavior.

Do not harass others.

In general, if someone asks you to stop something, then stop. When we disagree, try to understand why. Differences of opinion and disagreements are mostly unavoidable. What is important is that we resolve disagreements and differing views constructively.

Our differences can be our strengths.

We can find strength in diversity. Different people have different perspectives on issues, and that can be valuable for solving problems or generating new ideas. Being unable to understand why someone holds a viewpoint doesn’t mean that they’re wrong. Don’t forget that we all make mistakes, and blaming each other doesn’t get us anywhere.

Instead, focus on resolving issues and learning from mistakes.
Short: This is a private instance for a small community.
A place mainly for retro gamers and people who enjoy tech, gadgets, and photography

Description:
Donate

Oliphant Social is part of the larger social Fediverse, but the costs of hosting are not free. If you'd like to donate towards our running costs you can contribute by sending us a few bucks each month, or buying us a coffee. $oliphantastic on Cashapp.

If you prefer Patreon that's an option, too.

Server Details

  • Runs on a DigitalOcean cloud server which can be upscaled if needed
  • Runs behind CloudFlare for DDOS protection
  • Daily backups.
  • Database is running as a Managed Database at DigitalOcean, providing point-in-time restores, encryption of data at rest and in transmission, and the latest security and upgrades handled automatically.
  • Database is not accessible to the internet itself, only to the Mastodon(Glitch) server running oliphant.social.
  • ElasticSearch - Lets you do a full text search on your own posts, favorites, etc
  • Translation works on posts in foreign languages
  • Running Glitch-Soc fork of Mastodon which allows for (among other things), posting in Markdown, and a 5,000 character post limit.
  • All media is stored on an external Wasabi server, which works a lot like Amazon S3. The Wasabi server assets are fronted with the domain media.oliphant.social.
  • RSS feeds are disabled at the server level, as there is no opt-in or opt-out possible in either the Mastodon or Glitch forks.
  • Running Elk at https://elk.oliphant.social

Moderation

Oliphant Social maintains quite a long blocklist of defederation and is an active participant in discussions with multiple server admins and the fediblock hashtag.

Oliphant skews far to the left, many members are actively anti-fascist, anti-racist, and anti-capitalist, and accept no trolling or harassment--and rarely federate with any servers who do. (If we do so, it's probably an accident or oversight.)

If you're a logged-in user on this server, you can view our list of moderated servers below.

No Meta, No Threads

Proud to be part of the "Threadless fediverse." This server will never federate with threads.net or Meta.

Safe Harbor Policy

If you're on another server and you do not feel safe there and you need a safe space, please contact the server admin and we'll get you an invite.

View The Safe Harbor Policy

Legal

Please see our DMCA compliance policy for all US copyright claims.

Age Restriction

You must be 18 years old or older to use this service.
Short: A small but mighty band of warrior-poet oliphants. Safe harbor and fair speech zone.

Description:
About us

An international community for Museums, Galleries, Exhibitions and more. Proudly running on Mastodon in Amsterdam.

Moderation

We are currently moderating this instance based on our server rules. Please note that we might block you (or whole server instances) if you/they do not comply to our rules. German law applies.

Copyrighted Material

Please upload only media into Posts where you are the owner of the Copyright or you have written permission to do this. Be especially careful about images depicting people. If you are in doubt, then please only add a link to the original (external) source.

Privacy

We are not sharing any data with sponsors. We will never sell data to anyone.

Continuity of Service

The server is creating daily backups of all data: User Data, Uploaded Media and Database. We guarantee to give all users three months notice if we will decide to stop the mastodon service. In that case, we will also provide all Users a link to an online document explaining how to move your account to a different mastodon server. Please note that because of some Mastodon restrictions, not all data can be moved to a new server. Check the official Mastodon Docs for more info.

Behind the scenes

This Mastodon instance is provided by Chris Beer, a Freelance Consultant from the Netherlands. Our servers are hosted by DigitalOcean in a Datacenter in Amsterdam.

Costs for infrastructure are currently paid by the admins of the server and partially sponsored by Moebius. Other sponsors are of course welcome. Please DM @admin if interested. Please note that becoming a Sponsor will not mean that you would get access to any data of this community. As mentioned above (and let me repeat it to be 100% clear): We will not share data with Sponsors or with anyone else.

If you want to help with the costs of running this server then please consider making a donation. 100% of it will go into service costs for hardware, database and email providers. Donate
Short: A Community for Museums, Galleries, Exhibitions and more. Proudly running on Mastodon.

Description:

Description:
About labyrinth.social

labyrinth.social is a small Mastodon server for friends of Tom Dickinson, using the Hometown fork of Mastodon.

This about/readme document is mirrored between the labyrinth.social server and github pages. Hopefully they will always be in sync. This is the latest version as of 1/13/2024.

What is this?

Let's break that down into three different questions, increasingly granular as we go.

  1. What is Mastodon?
  2. What is Hometown?
  3. What is labyrinth.social?

What is Mastodon?

Mastodon is a social networking app.

In some ways, it's like Twitter, in that you make short posts and follow/reply to other users.

In other ways, it's nothing like Twitter, in that it's open source, and has no ads, and is "decentralized" this means that no one person or corporation owns the whole thing.

If you don't understand what I'm talking about, I get that. It's a little hard to explain. But here are two pretty good explanations.

  • A good, short video explanation from the official Mastodon youtube channel
  • A better, longer written explanation by me

There are many Mastodon servers out there, all talking to one another. This is one of them.

What is Hometown?

This server uses Hometown, an alternate version of Mastodon created by Darius Kazemi. Hometown has been altered to add some additional features that aren't in the main version of Mastodon. Yeah, you can do that! It's one of the cool things about open source software.

The most major differences are local-only posting, and exclusive lists. See the Hometown wiki for more information on the project and how it differs from regular Mastodon.

What is labyrinth.social?

Labyrinth.social is a deliberately small Hometown instance created by Tom Dickinson, for a few friends. Currently there are about 10 active users. I intend to invite more people but I don't think there will ever be more than around 50.

The name "labyrinth" was chosen because it is an interesting image/word that has a lot of different resonances, Mythology, design, architecture, puzzles, David Bowie in very tight pants, etc. My direct inspiration for using it comes from Jorge Luis Borges' 1941 short story "The Garden of Forking Paths", which is good and you should read it. Incidentally, if you're wondering who the old guy is in the @admin avatar or the picture on the About page, that's Borges.

Using labyrinth.social

How do I join?

labyrinth.social is invite only, and limited to Tom Dickinson's friends. If you want to know more about how I'm deciding who to invite, check out the Invitation Policy. The general gist is that I am only planning on inviting a small number of people I know pretty well. If that describes you and you're interested in joining, let me know!

That said even if you haven't joined labyrinth.social, you can still follow me and the other labyrinth.social users. All you need is an account on any Mastodon server. Actually there are some other kinds of servers that work too, but if you're new to all this then I recommend Mastodon.

If you're looking for some other server to join, skip to this section in the middle of my "What is Mastodon?" post, which has some advice on how to find one to join.

Who is already using labyrinth.social?

As of this writing, about 10 people. You can browse the Profile Directory to see the users who have opted in to appearing in it. But not everybody necessarily has! By default, this page will show you all the accounts that the server is federated with, if you just want to see labyrinth.social users you will need to select "from labyrinth.social only".

Policies

Users are required to read the Code of Conduct. It is recommended that you read the other policy documents as well.

  • Code of Conduct: This document details the standards of behavior. Reading this is mandatory for all users of labyrinth.social.
  • Terms of Service: This document contains general information about the operation of the service, including Admin rights, availability of service, and blacklisting/silencing of other instances. It's highly recommended that you read this.
  • Privacy Policy: This document explains what kind of data is collected by labyrinth.social, how it is used, and how it is protected. It's highly recommended that you read this.
  • Invitation Policy: This document provides some information about how I will decide whether or not to invite someone.
  • Federation Policy: This document explains the actions I can take to "defederate" (suspend or silence) other fediverse instance, and the general policies and practices that are in place on this server for doing so.

These are not just boilerplate documents, they are largely original documents written by me, so my goal is for them to be clear and readable. Although some of them do have some boilerplate language in them.

Any significant updates to any of these policies will be announced from the @admin@labyrinth.social account.

Local-Only Posting

One of the most important differences between Hometown and vanilla Mastodon is the ability to use Local Only posting. In the context of Hometown, local only posting is a per-post security option that lets you set whether that post can federate out to other servers or not.

Click here to read more about local-only posting and how it works on labyrinth.social.

Emoji

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

For the moment, I have chosen to add only a small subset of these emoji, most notably the custom flags and symbols from their Gender, Sexuality, and Relationships category. Other emojis from that set (or any other source) can be added by request to the admin.

Moderated Servers

If you're a logged in user of labyrinth.social, you can see a list of moderated (silenced or suspended) servers here.

The list of moderated servers is not publicly available to non-users, but information may be available by request.

How much does this cost and how is it paid for?

An estimate of the monthly cost of running labyrinth.social can be found here.

I don't charge users anything for labyrinth.social accounts and I can't imagine ever doing so. But if you'd like to chip in a bit, you can contribute to labyrinth.social's ko-fi page.

About this guide

This guide is published under a Creative Commons Zero v1.0 Universal license, which means you can copy and modify it, for any purpose you like. The guide is also built on an open-source repo on GitHub, so do whatever you want with it! You don't need any additional permisison beyond what I'm stating here, but if you use this as a basis I'd love to hear about what you've done with it, so drop me a line at tom [at] nowwearealltom [dot] com.

I also want to point out that guide includes a Welcome page for prospective users who I've informally invited but haven't sent an invite code to yet. Just calling it out here because it's the only page that isn't linked from any of the other pages on the guide (since it's not tailored for a general audience), but might still be of interest if you're curious about how I do things here.
Short: labyrinth.social is a small, invite-only Mastodon/Hometown server for pals who are in a labyrinth.

Description:
The Wider Web Code of Conduct

Welcome!

Wider Web is a Mastodon instance for people who I, Trevor Flowers, know and are of the open web and/or XR persuasion.

I want our 'local' timeline to have the feel of a comfy lunch table at the W3C TPAC: full of friendly conversation on a wide variety of topics.

I do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

I want this to be a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion.

Folks asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If someone asks you to leave them alone, leave them alone.

Unacceptable Behavior

The following behavior is not welcome anywhere:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion.
  • Holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism.
  • Deliberate or persistent misgendering.
  • Threats of violence.
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • Deliberate intimidation.
  • Publishing any individual's address, phone number, or other private identifying information without consent.
  • Sexual depictions of any sort.
  • Unwelcome sexual attention, including sharing sexual content with specific users without consent.
  • Gratuitous sexual images or behavior.
  • Simulated physical contact (e.g. textual descriptions like “*hug*” or “*backrub*”) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication without consent.
  • Sustained disruption of discussion.
  • Continued communications with someone who's asked that you leave them alone.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person’s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.

The following behavior is not allowed on the public timeline:

  • Graphic violent or sexual content.
  • Gratuitous advertizing or spam. It's fine to promote your work, but it shouldn't be the bulk of what you share.

Known Harassers

I may ban or silence users known to be harassers or abusers, even if they have not violated the rules of this instance. The mere presence of a harasser can make past or potential victims uncomfortable, and it can put potential victims who are unaware of the person's history in particular danger. Users are encouraged to individually mute, block, and/or report accounts they don't want to see.

At my discretion and without explanation I may take the additional step of blocking or silencing someone instance-wide if I believe they endanger the safe and welcoming space I'm trying to maintain.

Similarly, I may block other Mastodon instances if they are the source of harassment or unacceptable content.

Reporting

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact me. I will respond as promptly as I can but keep in mind that I have work and a family.

I will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At my discretion, I may publicly name a person about whom I’ve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them. I will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, I may take any action I deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom I've received complaints.

Credits and License

This document was based on the about page of the Wandering Shop.

This code of conduct is based on Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy.
Short: Wider Web is a Mastodon instance for people who Trevor Flowers knows and are of the open web and/or XR persuasion.
This is an invite-only Mastodon server run by Brad Fitzpatrick (bradfitz.com)
Private instance for a group of friends

Description:
Aviating.com Social runs the Glitch-soc version of Mastodon, allows 2000 character posts with rich text (Markdown or HTML), and federates widely. It is maintained for pilots (including student pilots; all pilots are student pilots) but we do not check your license when you join. This can be your general home on the Fediverse; we are not limited to aviation content. Yes, you can post your wordle scores.

We don't block viewpoints, will block abuse. See our site rules!

We are hosted in a secure data center, and our content is backed up on a schedule (hourly at this time) to storage hosted on the other side of the NA continent, using encrypted backups. We have three administrators with system and Mastodon administrative access (@mcdanlj, @juphoff, and @javier); others whom we trust may be added from time to time. No shutdown of this site is planned (lists.aviating.com has been running for a few decades) but if it is ever contemplated, we plan to give substantial warning, and outside of extenuating circumstances we expect that to be at least three months warning.

We have discovered that Gmail is labeling some account validation emails as "spam" so please check your spam folders for validation mails, and then please feed the AI monkeys by marking them as as "not spam" when you validate your account.

If you have a t-online.de email address, you will need to register here using a different email provider, as t-online.de block email widely.
Short: By pilots, for pilots.

Description:
Blop is a semi-private server for nice people, run by @jess@blop.social. It is a safe place to be.

To preserve a decent user experience it is limited to 50 signups, for which you (usually) need an invitation. Friends-of-friends are fine, but please don't post any invite links publicly.

Abusive, fascist, bigoted or exploitative instances will be actively defederated from this instance.

Data Location

The server is hosted and data is stored within the United Kingdom and subject to UK jurisdiction. Encrypted daily backups are stored within the UK.

Announcements

Any in-network announcements are usually made with the #blop hashtag.

Reporting and Moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has been actioned.

Funding

This server is privately funded - however if you wish to make a donation (and please by no means feel obligated to do so) then get in touch with Jessie.
Short:
Blop is a semi-private UK-based Mastodon service for nice people.

An invitation is required to join.

Description:
Bitte meldet uns Verhalten, das euch stört. Das schließt Verhalten von anderen Instanzen mit ein. Wenn ihr Accounts von anderen Instanzen meldet, dann setzt bitte auch immer den Haken, der die Meldung zusätzlich an den Admin der anderen Instanz weiterleitet

Account

Jeder Nutzerin und jedem Nutzer steht maximal ein Konto zu. Mehrfachanmeldungen sind nur mit schriftlicher Zustimmung von uns gestattet. (Bspw. zur Erstellung eines Projektkontos, oder zum Betreiben von Bots oder Zweitkonten).

Konten für kommerzielle Zwecke sind nicht erwünscht.

Wir behalten uns vor, Konten, die über 365 Tage keine Anmeldeaktivität aufweisen zu löschen.

Wir behalten uns vor, der Nutzerin oder dem Nutzer die Lizenz zur Nutzung des Dienstes zeitweise oder dauerhaft, jederzeit und ohne Angaben von Gründen zu entziehen. Ausgenommen davon sind gesetzliche Verpflichtungen und Bestimmungen.

Moderation

Für diese Instanz steht nur Moderation in Deutscher Sprache zur Verfügung. Falls Posts in anderen Sprachen gemeldet werden, werden diese deshalb ohne vorherige Prüfung gelöscht.

Piraten in Fediverse

Falls ihr auf der Suche nach Piraten im Fediverse seit, dann schaut euch doch bitte mal diesen Account an. Mit dem versuchen wir allen Accounts zu folgen, die wir finden können. Falls wir jemanden übersehen haben, gerne den fehlenden Account an Whydah melden.

Wir haben für euch die Gruppe @piratenpartei@a.gup.pe eingerichtet, das ist ein Bot, über den man Nachrichten mit einer Gruppe teilen kann. Dazu müsst ihr einfach nur diesem Account folgen und ihn bei Nachrichten an alle in dem Post erwähnen.
Short: Dies Instanz ist ein privates Angebot an all die, die Interesse an der Piraten-Partei haben und das Fediverse kennenlernen wollen.

Description:
“Seid gut zueinander” ist leichter gesagt als getan und bedeutet für verschiedene Menschen unterschiedliche Dinge.

Bei den folgenden Regeln handelt es sich um eine (nicht erschöpfende) Liste von Verhaltensweisen, die nach dem Ermessen der Instanzadministratoren zur Löschung von Beiträgen, zur Stummschaltung oder zur Sperrung von Konten führen können, wie in unseren Nutzungsbedingungen beschrieben.

Bitte melden Sie Verhaltensweisen, die Sie stören. Wir werden Ihre Meldung vertraulich behandeln.

Wir dulden kein diskriminierendes Verhalten und keine Inhalte, die die Unterdrückung von Mitgliedern von marginalisierten Gruppen fördern oder befürworten. Diese Gruppen können sich durch eine der folgenden Eigenschaften auszeichnen (wobei diese Liste natürlich unvollständig ist):

  • Ethnizität
  • geschlechtliche Identität oder Ausdruck
  • sexuelle Identität oder sexueller Ausdruck
  • körperliche Merkmale oder Alter
  • Behinderung oder Krankheit
  • Nationalität, Wohnsitz, Bürgerstatus
  • Vermögen oder Bildung
  • Religionszugehörigkeit, Agnostizismus oder Atheismus

Wir dulden kein bedrohliches Verhalten, kein Stalking und kein Doxxing.
Wir tolerieren keine Belästigung, einschließlich Brigading, Dogpiling oder jede andere Form der Kontaktaufnahme mit einer Nutzerin oder einem Nutzer, der angegeben hat, dass er nicht kontaktiert werden möchte.

Wir dulden kein Mobbing, einschließlich Beschimpfungen, absichtliche Falschbezeichnung oder Deadnaming.
Wir dulden keine gewalttätige nationalistische Propaganda, Nazi-Symbolik oder die Förderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus.
Wir dulden keine Verschwörungserzählungen oder andere reaktionäre Mythen, die das oben genannte (und/oder ähnliche) Verhalten unterstützen oder dazu führen.
Handlungen, die darauf abzielen, diese Instanz oder ihre Leistung zu schädigen, können zur sofortigen Sperrung des Accounts führen.
Inhalte, die in Deutschland illegal sind, werden gelöscht und können zu einer sofortigen Sperrung des Kontos führen.

Support

Support für diese Instanz kann gerne via Matrix Chat erreicht werden: #hub.uckermark.social:matrix.mxhdr.net

Wer noch keinen Matrix Chat account hat, kann gerne via https://element-web.explain-it.org/ einen anlegen.
Short: Ein Mastodon Server für und von Menschen aus der Uckermark.
A Mastodon instance for Viper's friends, their brand accounts and frequent collaborators.

Description:
ABOUT

This server is managed by VOST Portugal, Associação de Voluntários em Situações de Emergência.

WHY?

VOST Portugal understand the nature, and complexity, of running a decentralized social network, and didn't want to impose certain features that it deems essencial on other servers.

Can I use your server?

If you are a VOSTie yes. If you aren't we are sorry, but that won't be possible.
Short: This server is exclusive for VOSTies and VOST related accounts. Supported by VOST Portugal.
Mostly hackers, mostly in Urbana, IL, talking to each other & our friends on like-minded servers without giving our personal data to the marketing machine.

Moderation policy (Code of Conduct) Accounts on this server are solely ON2IT employees. User behaviour and content are required to comply with employment contracts, the ON2IT employee handbook and code of conduct (14.3). Content and behaviour which is not in compliance is expressly forbidden.

Identity verification is a requirement to use this server.

In order to sign up for an account, you have to login to the ON2IT SSO server which establishes your Mastodon handle.
Short: Provided by ON2IT, for employees of ON2IT

Description:
When I first found Mastodon in early 2022, I loved the idea of instances based on interest or geography or whatever it was. I looked for a Maine-centric instance, but no luck. For the next several months, I used Mastodon on and off, but it wasn't until Elon's purchase was finalized that I dove in more completely. Much to my disappointment, still no instance specific to Maine people. So here we are.

Ain't that cunnin'?
Short: Ain't That Cunnin' is a Fediverse instance running Mastodon intended as a community hub for folks who live in Maine.

Description:
Filosofia / vocació

Mastodon per usuaris que enraonin (de tant en tant) el català que es parla a País Valencià o el valencià que es parla a Catalunya, o sigui, la nostra llengua, de Salses a Guardamar i de l'Alguer a Fraga.

Si no la parleu, però toqueu temes (de tant en tant) relacionats amb els Països Catalans, també hi sou benvinguts.

També és una instància que pretén fomentar el debat, respectuós, d'idees i combatre la censura del Pensament Únic que basteixen uns mitjans de comunicació controlats, directa o indirectament, pel Capital. Si no sabeu de què parlo, llegiu a Chomsky.

Per dir-ho d'alguna manera, les idees, per antagòniques que siguin amb les pròpies, no es rebutgen aquí, sinó que en tot cas es debaten i s'argumenten. I això cal fer-ho amb unes mínimes regles de l'educació i la cortesia.

Això si, cadascú es fa responsable de què diu, davant de la seva consciència i de "les lleis dels homes" (per desgràcia no acostumen a ser de les dones).

Aquesta instància vol contribuir a construir unes xarxes socials lliures, de base més democràtica i amb una vocació clara de servei públic. En el nostre cas som part del Fedivers

D'entrada aquesta instància és finançada per calbasi.net, però aspira a ser finançada pel micromecenatge dels seus usuaris. Només que un 3% poguessin donar una quantitat simbòlica, ja ho tindríem. Quin luxe, no? Un Twitter de la gent, només per la suma de petites contribucions d'uns quants! ;-) Un dia d'aquests us indicaré com podeu contribuir-hi. I us ho agraeixo d'avançada!
Short: Si busques recer a les xarxes lliures, sigues benvingut/da!
A Mastodon server for residents of Detroit, MI.

Description:
How To Make The Most of Hooray! Computer

  • Consider this less as a public forum like Twitter and more like you’re hanging out with your friends in your back yard.
  • New to Mastodon and how to get thing sorted out here? Ask @josh!
  • It’s easy to pick up and go to another server if you like the vibe there better. All your connections go with you!
    • You’ll be welcomed back if you leave, unless we ban you for violating the rules.

  • Post your art, your photos, and cute things. We want to see that stuff! But: please use alt tags so everyone can enjoy what you post.

Community Rules

  • You're free to say what you like, but we're also free to show you the door if you're being an asshole. Best to be kind.
  • Most content is fine here as long as it isn’t racist, illegal, or bigoted. You will be banned.
  • 🌈 pals welcomed.
  • Invite a few people you’d like to see here, as long as they aren’t Elon.
Short: A small, uplifting community of artists, nerds, and other misfits. We have cute animal pictures.
This is for conversation about content technology: CMS, DAM, CMP, APIs, etc.

Description:
Rules ¶

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators, as described in our Terms.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.


Best practices ¶

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions. Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network. Thank you!)

Attribution ¶

This text is free to be adapted and remixed under the terms of the CC-BY (Attribution 4.0 International) license.
Nuwardia Social: An independent Pleroma instance

110% not a "free speech zone"; break the rules and you'll be removed. Rules are subject to evolution and admin's judgement.

Rules

  • Don't be a dick

Description:
Back in times of yore, before Facebook ruined the world, there was a music forum called 4four. It was the centre of the world for underground house, techno, and electro - especially if you were from the fabled city of Londonium.

It was home to DJs, producers, club-owners, promoters, and most importantly the fans of underground electronic club culture, who would talk long into the night about the latest Drexciya release.

Then Facebook came and wiped 4four off the map. It was a sad day, and we all went our separate ways. But there's a new player in town: Mastodon, it's a bit like Twitter, but it allows users to set up their own servers as part of a federated universe (lots of servers talking to each other).

Most importantly on each server there's a "local feed". This local-feed means that if we gather fans of underground electronic club-culture on one server, then we get the equivalent of a local village, similar to how 4four was, but with the ability to wander to the wider world like Twitter/Facebook. It's a bit like having your cake and eating it.

And so that's what this is, 4four.org is a Mastodon server for underground electronic club-culture. If like me you consider Instagram a vacuous plague-pit of narcissism, Facebook a wall of adverts, and Twitter a platform in a death-spiral then give this a try... And when you sign-up you get a cool username (yourname@4four.org) too!

There are currently a limited number of spaces (the more users, the more it costs me to run the server, so I will keep an eye on demand and open it up to new users occasionally).
Short:
Based around the house, techno, and electro scene.  Run by, producer and DJ, Agile Kind.

If you're into underground electronic music, sign up!

Description:
Welcome to Maker Social!

What We Are

Maker Social is a social networking space for makers, by makers.

Who we are

Maker Social is an independent, non-profit effort initiated by Steve Scotten and Blaise Hartley, two members of the Tech Valley Center of Gravity, an amazing makerspace, co-working space, prototyping center, and incubator in Troy NY. It is our hope that once it takes off, Maker Social will be officially adopted by the TVCOG as a permanent contribution to and haven for the maker movement in general, and the Tech Valley maker community in particular.

Philosophy

Maker Social is intended to be an inclusive, friendly home for makers, artists, tinkerers, and creators of all kinds to venture out into the burgeoning corporation-free social media space.

We aren't here to promote politics or ideology, we are here to build a community to encourage and assist every kind of creator in freely sharing their work and thoughts with other creators.

Problem Reporting

Please use the built-in reporting tools to let us know about any posts you believe violate the rules. For anything else, please forward any problems, questions, or concerns directly to the administrator contact.
Short: A social space for makers, by makers. Federate your projects here!

Description:
🍵Partage tes lectures et découvre ce que lisent tes ami.e.s!

📖 Track your reading and find out what your friends are reading!

Mille feuilles est un réseau social pour suivre et partager sa lecture, sans publicité et anti-corporatif, basé sur le logiciel open-source Bookwyrm. Depuis Mille feuilles, on peut suivre et interagir de manière transparente avec les utilisat∙eurs∙ices d'autres instances BookWyrm ou Mastodon, ou simplement interagir avec les autres lecteurices sur Mille feuilles. Mille feuilles est un site à petite vitesse, afin de garantir que ce service évolue de manière durable.

Mille feuilles is a small, ad-free, and anti-corporate social network about books which runs on open-source Bookwyrm software. From Mille feuilles, you can seamlessly follow and interact with users on other BookWyrm instances and on services like Mastodon, or just interact with other users on Mille feuilles. Mille feuilles is growing very slowly, in order to ensure that the website scales in a sustainable way.

For my English-speaking visitors, a mille-feuille is a popular type of pastry, and the name literally translates as "thousand leaves."

Un très chaleureux merci à Arcane Pigeon pour notre logo cute à croquer!
Short: Une instance Bookwyrm pour les papivores! 🍵📖 A Bookwyrm instance for those who enjoy a leafy snack!

Description:
歡迎합니다!

國漢象會는 國漢文混用을 하는 韓國語 서버입니다. 韓國語를 할 줄 아시는 분은 自由롭게 加入하여 活動하실 수 있으며, 定해진 主題는 따로 없습니다.

規則에 對하여

아래 '서버 規則'欄에 적힌 內容은 基本的인 原則만을 明示합니다. 하지만 禁止하는 條項이 따로 없더라도 規則에 明示된 基本的인 原理에 어긋나는 言動은 禁止됩니다.

例를 들어, 2番 規則에 따르면 差別의 意圖를 가지거나 特定 對象을 嫌惡하는 發言, 다른 사람을 괴롭히는 行爲等은 “基本的인 禮儀를 갖추지 않는 言行”이기 때문에 禁止됩니다.

大部分의 境遇, 基本原則만 지켜 주시면 不便한 일은 없을 것이라 생각합니다.

語文 使用에 對하여

되도록 韓國語를 使用해 주시되, 漢字語는 漢字로 적는 國漢文混用을 해 주세요. 釋讀(訓讀)方式을 利用한 表記는 推薦하지 않습니다.

使用環境 問題로 漢字 入力이 不便하거나 어려우신 분들은 國漢大百科의 漢字 入力 도움말 을 參考해 보세요.

Description:
This Mastodon instance is dedicated to the Club der Ehemaligen der Deutschen SchülerAkademien e.V. (CdE). For more information about the CdE e.V., see https://www.cde-ev.de.

This is a small instance and most of its users know each other personally. Moreover, we have come to love the CdE as a community of very friendly and smart people. Therefore, we hope that no moderator intervention will become necessary here.

Nevertheless, if conflicts arise that make this necessary, it is good to have a guideline on allowed content and behavior. We also want to commit to this policy towards other Mastodon instances, so they can decide if they want to federate with us.

We adopt the rules from https://chaos.social for this purpose. Thanks to @leah@chaos.social and @rixx@chaos.social who put a lot of thought into this and allow us to use this text under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0.

Rules

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("…@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

Attribution

This text is free to be adapted and remixed under the terms of the Creative Commons BY-NC-SA (Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International) license.

This text is based on the work by Leah Oswald (@leah@chaos.social) and Tobias Kunze (@rixx@chaos.social), provided at github.com/chaossocial/about .
Short: Ein (inoffizielles) soziales Netzwerk für den Club der Ehemaligen der Deutschen SchülerAkademien e. V.

Description:
Primarily offered as an easier alternative to self hosting for indie game studio or project accounts. This is not a "community" instance in the sense that there are no general/personal accounts on the Local timeline.

Users of this instance are expected to stay on topic: indie games, the game development process, technical discussion or dev logs, games industry news, and other closely related subjects.

If you want to create a personal account as an individual, you may be better served by a more general, individual focused instance:

  • indiegames.online's list of gamedev related servers
  • joinmastodon.org's list of instances on various topics

Visit the indiegames.online hub page for a more long winded blurb about what this instance is for, and why it exists.

indiegames.online is a service provided by Tentacle Head Games, and administered by @brook@sunny.garden.

Description: Akkoma: The cooler fediverse server

My Three Weed Smoking Girlfriends refers to a popular Tumblr post in which user thejorie posted a picture of three women sharing a marijuana cigarette while dressed in cannabis-related clothing and wrote, "My three girlfriends. And yes, they smoke weed." thejorie appeared to be trolling, but as people who weren't in on the joke reblogged the thread mocking his post, thejorie wrote escalating, elaborate threats and roleplay scenarios defending his "girlfriends" and writing how he'd attack people in the thread, going overboard as an Internet Tough Guy. The entire thread spread outside of Tumblr and inspired comics and videos in which the dialogue was played out by different characters.
Short: Beppo di bepis bam bam boop di boop

Description: Our goal as a community is to be an inclusive and safe place for furries to gather on the internet. This lends the unique opertunity for us to build out our game servers, social platforms, and all you see here, in the name of having a free inclusive and safe place to simply exist on the internet and have fun. If you want to be part of our community, we welcome you with open arms and the same goes for if you want to volunteer and help out! All staff members are community members who volunteer to lead and help our community. Sometimes this means helping write code, or maintaning a game server, or even moderating chats. There are many things we do at Furry Refuge to cultivate an amazing community, but the reason is always the same. Community is everything and we want you to feel at home here!
Short: A gateway to the Fediverse and social media platform for the Furry Refuge community! Meet Up, Game On, Chill Out!

Description:
BAKGRUND

Nätverket/servern/instansen Biblioverse.online (hädanefter Biblioverse) startades i november 2022 av två mastodonanvändare som till vardags är anställda inom svenska bibliotekssektorn. Nätverket drivs ideellt och är inte framtaget på något initiativ från någon av våra arbetsgivare. De är heller inte involverade i vad vi gör här.

Den svenska delen av fediversumet har sedan lång tid haft få nätverk med nischade inriktningar. De större nätverken har ofta fungerat som ”all-around”-kanaler där det går att prata högt och lågt, om allting och ingenting. Dessa nätverk har tusentals användare som tillsammans skapar ett livligt flöde. Gott så, men vi eftersökte dock ett eget litet socialt hörn, där tjänstemän i svenska bibliotekssektorn dels kunde lära känna varandra och prata om vardagliga ting men även utbyta tankar och erfarenheter från vår profession i ett eget, avgränsat, översiktligt lokalt flöde. Det fina med fediverse är att du ändå kan skräddarsy ditt eget personliga flöde så att det inkluderar användare från andra nätverk.

ATT SKAFFA KONTO PÅ BIBLIOVERSE

Antalet platser på nätverket är begränsat och insläpp sker efter att ansökan har behandlats av oss. I din ansökan finns det också ett fält där du ska ange en motivering till varför du vill ansluta dig till Biblioverse. Presentera dig gärna för oss med ett par meningar i detta fält, men lägg inte så mycket tid på det. För egentligen används denna funktion till att hindra botar från att ta plats. Erfarenheter från större nätverk visar på att detta tillvägagångssätt har varit enormt effektivt mot denna typ av spam.

REGLER PÅ BIBLIOVERSE

Genom att registrera dig på Biblioverse så förpliktigar du dig att följa nätverkets regler. De följer i mångt och mycket de flesta andra mastodonnätverkens framarbetade regelverk. Vi i bibliotekssektorn är väl i grund och botten människor med gott sunt förnuft - och det får ju gärna vara en ledstjärna här också!

Vi uppmuntrar användare av Biblioverse att överväga användarupplevelsen för alla andra här. Det är inte bara en fråga om etikett och tillgänglighet, egentligen. Det handlar om att bara vara en anständig person. Vara snäll. Det kostar praktiskt taget inget att göra saker enklare och trevligare för andra, så lägg till beskrivningar till bilder, skriv hashtaggar med kamelnotation (alltså MedVersalFörVarjePåbörjatOrd), och använd gärna Content Warnings (CW) generöst. Exempel där CW kan tas i beaktning skulle kunna vara inlägg med våldsamma bilder, sex och naket, politik, psykisk ohälsa, bilder med ögonkontakt. Det är ingen exakt vetenskap hur detta ska brukas, och som en motvikt går det också som användare att använda filter för att automatiskt gömma andras inlägg som innehåller ämnen du inte vill ta del av. Lika enkelt går det också att ställa in att CW-inlägg visas ofiltrerat som om de vore "vanliga" inlägg. Mycket i Mastodon går att ställa in till sin egen belåtenhet och användarupplevelse, vilket är en av dess styrkor.

Vidare har vi stolpat upp ett antal riktlinjer under fliken Serverregler nedan. Dessa riktlinjer är inte ett juridiskt dokument och slutlig tolkning görs av Administratörer/Moderatorer på Biblioverse.

Summa summarum: var sjyssta mot varandra, hjälp varandra! Och glöm inte att ha roligt!

VID TRAKASSERIER

Om du blir trakasserad, vänligen rapportera användaren med knappen "..." och sedan "Rapportera". För brådskande frågor, vänligen kontakta en administratör/moderator.

MODERERADE SERVRAR

En av Mastodons fördelar är att man lätt kan klippa av band till andra nätverk i fediversumet så att varken deras användare kan följa er eller att deras innehåll når våra tidslinjer. Vi tycker att det är viktigt att våra användare ska känna sig trygga på Biblioverse, så vi följer med intresse de diskussioner om serverbans som förs och rapporteras av andra admins i fediversumet. Vi gör vårt yttersta för att defederera nätverk som har antidemokratiska agendor, trollfabriker, spam och annat skräp.

FRAMTIDSUTSIKTER

Biblioverse är i dess nuvarande form ett tämligen litet nätverk. Med “litet” menar vi en användarbas upp till 50 användare. I takt med att fediversumet expanderar kanske efterfrågan gör att även vår användarbas behöver utökas till 100. Detta låter förstås optimistiskt, och tiden får utvisa huruvida det blir så. Vi har dock inga som helst ambitioner att bli större än såhär, att samla Sveriges samtliga tjänstemän inom bibliotekssektorn är inte aktuellt. Nätverket ska förbli ett förhållandevis litet och trevligt community, med fokus på kvalitet snarare än kvantitet.

VILL DU BIDRA?

Biblioverse tar i dess nuvarande form inte särskilt mycket tid och monetära resurser i anspråk från oss administratörer. För oss handlar det blott om några hundralappar i månaden, no big deal. Vi kommer aldrig att kräva pengar av er. Vi gör det här för att vi tycker att det är kul, samt för att vi anser att federerade tjänster är spännande och kanske en början på ett förnyat förhållningssätt till sociala medier, bortom övervakning, datainsamling och algoritmstyrda konversationer.

Beroende på omständigheterna så kan det i framtiden öppnas upp möjligheter för att bli moderator på Biblioverse. Hör gärna av dig till administratörerna ifall du är intresserad!

Om du tycker att det vi gör här är toppen och vill bidra med pengar till att upprätthålla driften av Biblioverse så finns det möjlighet att donera pengar till oss. Stort som smått, engångssummor som månatliga inbetalningar, spelar ingen roll. Donationerna går direkt in till det konto som används för att betala nätverkets driftskostnader. Om du vill donera så kan du göra det på Ko-fi.

FELANMÄLAN

Anmäl fel till Administratörer/moderatorer. Inkludera en kort men relevant beskrivning av felet, exempelvis: Vad hände? När hände det? Hur mycket av det hände? Kan du visa ett exempel?

Väl mött, fedinauter!
Elegansen och Akenyg (Administratörer på Biblioverse)
Short: En liten mastodonserver, drivs ideellt av två biblioteksmedarbetare. Målgrupp är yrkesverksamma i bibliotekssektorn, inkl. biblioteksutvecklare och forskare inom biblioteks- och informationsvetenskap.

Description:
Sunet är en del av statliga Vetenskapsrådet och tillhandahåller IT-infrastruktur och digitala verktyg till lärosäten och andra myndigheter. Det här är vår Mastodonserver och den riktar sig specifikt till de som är knutna till högre utbildning och forskning.

Alla som tillhör ett lärosäte i Sverige kan logga in via Single Sign On med SeamlessAccess och det vanliga inloggningsflödet från lärosätet, för att på så sätt skapa ett konto i vår instans.

Kom ihåg att du alltid behöver logga in via knappen SeamlessAccess. Det är viktigt att du anger samma e-postadress som du har i lärosätets katalog när du skapar kontot.

Lösenordet som anges vid kontoskapandet behövs bara just vid kontoskapandet, sedan loggar du in via Single Sign On (SeamlessAccess) med ditt konto från lärosätet och de inloggningsuppgifter du har där.
Short: En server för högre utbildning och forskning i Sverige. Tillhandahålls av Sunet (Swedish University Computer Network)

Description:
Why OSINTukraine ?

OSINT tools to archive, document and debunk the Russian War against Ukraine This project is a Telegram Archive, a News aggregator & publishing engine designed to support Ukraine and keep Ukraine information in the News cycle.

You can check out the project here

To eliminate the language barrier issue as much as possible with the current state of machine translation,

I still remember 2014 and how the invasion of Crimea & Donbass left Ukraine voiceless.

Provide a solution for newsrooms, journalists, activists and basically everyone to have an easier access to this information for certainly, one of the defining moment of our generation in Europe and the global impact the War on Ukraine unleashed.

Hunt for Russian Disinformation narratives and war crimes with the intent to archive it outside big platforms

Find intelligence signal in the ongoing cyberwar leaks and operations to disrupt Putin and the system he controls to wage war on Ukraine.

Pressure European capitals to not concede a pre-cooked defeat with Putin at the cost of Ukraine integrity.

Pressure Western Governments to actually deliver their Help to Ukraine

Boycott Amnesty International until the organization retract the “report” and formally apologies to Ukraine.

Put the Media under pressure for not covering Ukraine, putting constantly the aggressor propaganda instead of the impact of the war against Ukraine.

Pressure Western Governments and allies to Officially designate Russia as a Terrorist State.

Weapons for Ukraine because a genocidal war from a Terrorist State does not get stopped by wishful thinking for peace.
Short: This server is hosted by OSINTukraine.com, its purpose is to host a set of bots auto-sharing DeepL translated post from the Russian and Ukrainian Telegram ecosystems.

Description:
social.ffmuc.net ist eine von Freifunk München betriebene Mastodon-Instanz

=== Aktuell im Testbetrieb ===

Registrierungen auf social.ffmuc.net sind nur gegen eine monatliche Gebühr möglich, um den Betrieb dieser Instanz und Freifunk München finanziell sicherzustellen.

Daraus ergeben sich weitere Vorteile für die Community:
- Die Hemmschwelle, Inhalte zu veröffentlichen, die gegen die Regeln verstoßen, wird angehoben
- Die Anzahl der Nutzer bleibt in einem moderierbaren Rahmen

Wir möchten jedoch darauf hinweisen, dass der Betrieb dieser Instanz auf einer Best-Effort-Basis erfolgt. Es gibt keine Uptime-Versprechen oder Garantien, dass alles ohne Probleme funktioniert.
Mit der Gebühr sind auch keine Sonderrechte für den eigenen Account verbunden, d.h. Inhalte, die gegen die Regeln verstoßen, werden weiterhin moderiert.
Short:
social.ffmuc.net ist eine von Freifunk München betriebene Mastodon-Instanz

=== Aktuell im Testbetrieb ===

Description:
We're a gaming community that's been floating around on the internet since 2003. Some of us like games.

Started this up as a bit of an experiment, but people use it, so here we are. Feel free to join, we're generally friendly.

We don't sell your information

As far as we're concerned your personal information is yours, we don't sell it or pass it to 3rd parties.

We don't push ads, nor will we. We don't ask for donations as at present the costs of us offering this aren't worth it and we're more than happy to cover the hosting costs to further promote a decentralised open web.

Information about Mastodon apps

If a Mastodon app requests a server for login, that should be entered as mstdn.gamercast.net.

Other amazing things run on gamercast.net like our website, which is why that typically won't work. 🙂

Security

This server scores A+ on Mozilla Observatory and A+ on cryptcheck.fr.

We highly recommend setting up 2FA in your account settings under Account -> Account settings -> Two-factor Auth when using the web interface.

Moderation Team

Please reach out to the moderation team if you have any problems.

  • @RoofusLukas
  • @Paul

Server information

The server is based in Colo-X's Interxion LON 1 datacentre in London, UK.
Short: We're a gaming community that's been floating around on the internet since 2003. Some of us like games.

Description:
Eine Instanz für alle Kunst- und Kulturinteressierten, für Museen, Vereine und Initiativen, betrieben von Museumsleuten und anderen aus dem Kunst- und Kulturbetrieb. Mithelfer*innen für die Administration und Moderation willkommen!

An instance for all those interested in art and culture, for museums, associations and initiatives, run by museum people and others from the art and cultural sector. Help welcome for administration and moderation.

Description:
This server is a nod to the now defunct streaming service beam.pro. Beam is where many of the people on this server met and hung out until it inevitably shut down. One of the creators of the platform, Matt Salsamendi, would occasionally stream various laser lightshows which is the inspiration of the lasersare.fun domain.

As a result, lasersare.fun is a place that aims to continue that close knit community atmosphere that Beam once had.

The server thumbnail picture is from one of Matt Salsamendi's laser shows. Full credits to him for that.

This server is not affiliated in any way to Beam or Mixer. It is also not affiliated with any of the owner(s) of Beam or Mixer.
Short: A social platform inspired by the now defunct beam.pro streaming service.

Description:
Risk.social is a Mastodon instance for professionals in risk and insurance — although anyone who follows our rules and guidelines is welcome.

Risk.social is working on adhering to the Mastodon server covenant:

  1. Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia. Server rules and moderation are in effect.
  2. Daily backups. Risk.social is automatically backed up weekly. Working on implementing daily database backups.
  3. At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure. Looking for a suitable emergency admin. Is it you? Apply within.
  4. Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down. Committed.

Funding

Funding is provided from the back pocket of @craig. Should additional funding be necessary, donations will be accepted. Until then, enjoy the free ride!

Reporting and moderation

You can report directly from an individual posting, image, or profile for certain violations, including: spam, abusive or harmful content, inappropriate ads, self-harm and impersonation.

Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a moderation or other action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

This instance is hosted in New York. United States and New York laws apply.
Short: Mastodon server for risk and insurance.

Description:
Orreadi is a portmanteau of the Singaporean English ('Singlish') word 'orreddi' and 'read'. The word 'orreddi' is itself the Singlish (mis)pronunciation of the word "already". Orreadi therefore helps you track all the books you read orreadi and get ideas for what to read next based on what your friends have read orreadi.

Orreadi is hosted and administered in Singapore and welcomes users from across the world.

If you've come from Goodreads or Librarything, yes, Orreadi is a lot like those platforms in that it is in essence a book social network and recommendation site. The difference is that Orreadi runs on open source software called BookWyrm and is a part of the Fediverse. You can seamlessly follow and interact with users on other BookWyrm instances, and on other Fediverse services like Mastodon and Pixelfed.
Short: Track the books you read orreadi and find out what your friends orreadi read.

Description:

This is a Mastodon instance for Malaysians hosted in Malaysia.

This instance is for people who are interested in open source technology and the awesome community around it. Whether that be Linux, open source software like Firefox, Matrix or Mastodon itself. If you're interested in technology, This is a great place to start.

What is Mastodon?

Video

What's behind?

  • 4 Nodes: 50 GiB RAM, 32.4 GHz CPU
  • Hashicorp Nomad cluster
  • Linux based
  • 3 x Raspberry Pi 4th model B (running on SSD's)
  • 1 x Dell T20
  • AWS S3 for media storage with CloudFront
  • Automated daily backups for DB and Redis
  • Located in Perak, MY
  • Status page

Description:
Away Message Club is a little Mastodon service for people who miss when the most social we got was carefully choosing song lyrics for our AIM away messages. These rules are based on the policies and goals of other instances such as queer.party, aiming as much as possible to be a safe space for its users. The rules pretty much boil down to "be good to each other", but a few rules I'd like to explicitly list out are as follows:

  • Any content or postings which may be illegal under German or Scottish law are not permitted.
  • Any content or postings containing Nazi symbolism, ideology and the promotion thereof, are strictly forbidden and seriously uncool.
  • Racism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia and any other discriminatory conduct which attacks any individual or group of individuals based on what they are or what they believe in, is strictly forbidden and also seriously uncool.
  • Any conduct which abuses this Mastodon instance, or which causes harm to other Mastodon instances, and/or the users thereof, is strictly forbidden and seriously uncool.
  • While essentially all posts not violating the above are welcome on this instance, you are asked to be considerate and respectful of others - for example, tagging a post about a controversial subject or a commonly-held phobia using content warnings.
  • Basic parts of your user profile, such as username/display name, profile picture and banner, must not be explicit in nature.
  • Explicit/NSFW content is allowed, but must be appropriately tagged using the sensitive media and content warning tags.

This is not Twitter. Reporting posts that make you feel uncomfortable, or that you feel should be brought to our attention, is encouraged. Your reports will not be ignored, and will be dealt with (usually) within a few days. Due to timezone differences or just the fact that I have a full-time job, it may take more than a week. When filing a report, please include information about why you are making the report.

As this instance, and the fediverse in general, has grown, so too have the moderation demands -- in complex cases, I will reach out to you regarding your report, either to explain the moderation decision taken (if any) or to ask for more information, but for more obvious cases, I unfortunately no longer have the time to notify you as to the status of your report. If your report involves a user or post on another instance, you have the choice of sharing your report with the administration of that instance as well, but the report will always be sent to us.

No moderation actions are automatic whatsoever. Nothing happens without human review, and I try my utmost to do right by the users on this instance. For anything that isn't covered by reporting things in Mastodon, or if you have any questions, concerns or other thoughts, please either direct-message @stoppableforce@awaymessage.club, or email the queries address posted above - this goes directly to my inbox.
Short: a little Mastodon service for people who miss when the most social we got was carefully choosing song lyrics for our AIM away messages

A place to chat and hang out.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

What is Pan?

Pan is a node of the Fediverse, an ensemble independent servers/communities/nodes that communicate among each others.

A brief story

Tommi, the founder and administrator of this instance, has been a long time Fediverse enthusiastic user.

During Scambi Festival 2022, he invited the Italian collective Etica Digitale to host a Lab about it, and for the occasion we deployed a temporary, experimental Mastodon server.

In November 2022 we decided to step up the game, and found a more stable and meaningful instance. We named it Pan. This instance is born out of the necessity of creating a cozy, friendly, young, enthusiastic and tight community of people who believe in the same values and have some things in common.

Why this name?

Scambi Festival’s staff invented Paneurethic, a neologism synthesizing the essence of our purposes and our values. In a hurry to decide how to name our community, our fabulous Lea and Marghe suggested Pan, from the ancient Greek Πάν (Everything). This terms reflects the chaotic vortex of our collective action, while sharing the root of our neologism.

But how does the pan.rent domain name comes into play?
While scrolling through all the possibile domain names, Tommi stumbled upon this TLD, and he could not avoid thinking about his favorite musical ever, the 1996 Rent, by Jonathan Larson. In particular, this passage seems tailored for us:

We’re not gonna pay
Last year’s rent
This year’s rent
Next year’s rent
Rent rent rent rent rent
We’re not gonna pay rent
’Cause everything is rent

In conclusion, our name wonderfully labels the identity of a group of people and organizations that fight for a better future, for being an “us” for once, instead of a “them”. We are swirling in a messy messed up pan, dominated by the toxic, destructive ethos of Capitalism and egoism.

Our values

In short, we stand everything that entails a better, sustainable and fair future, and we fight for anything against it.

Practically, this means that Pan:

  • stands strongly against Capitalism as an economic model and a mentality
  • believes in the right of gender auto-determination and condemns any kind of gender discrimination
  • strongly favors of any empowerment of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights
  • supports and shares any effort carried out in a choral perspective, and without exploiting anyone
  • sympathizes with under-represented peaceful minorities

Who are we?

Anyone who has a profile on Pan must share some fundamental characteristics:

  • being under-30. We do not discriminate older people and we do not think to be better, but we want to foster debates, dialogue, and sense of belonging among individuals that share the struggles as well as the privileges of belonging to the same generation.
  • understanding English. On this instance, we write, chat, speak, and shout in any language. Still, there needs to be some common ground for dialoguing and understanding each other when it is time to have discussions regarding us all.

Institutions and organizations

Among us, there are not only people, but also associations, institutions, organization and entities. Naturally, no age restriction applies to them, but at the same time we demand a close adherence to our philosophy.

Want to join?

You might have noticed that public subscriptions are closed. This is not because we want to be exclusive, but rather the opposite! We would love to welcome anyone who is interested, but we really want to make sure that you are sure you are convinced to be part of this community, and not of any community.

To be invited to create an account, get in touch! You can also ask us to provide you with links to create more than one account, so that you can take some friends with you!

If you are looking for other communities, check Fediverse Observer’s, FediDB’s, or The Federation’s nodes lists.

Why the Glitch fork of Mastodon?

Pan runs on Mastodon Glitch Edition because it is full of interesting and crazy features, even if it is a bit crazier and unstable: it perfectly reflects this instance’s philosophy.
Short: A tiny, tight, and warm community of friends.
